text: bottle at beerlovers bar. Pours dark, 99 % black, small grey head. Smell is very full, coffee / roasty, very mild red fruits. creamy, rye, even though im not convinced id be able to name that blindly. Taste is very full, intense body. The rye shines trough nicely. This grainbeer is in perfect balance ! Still get some very distant red fruits. Chewy ending, thick body, very nice carbo. A very surprisingly good beer !

Black with medium creamy brown head. Bread aroma. Soft remarkable bitterness with roasted grain and the bread notes with moderate kvass type sweet-sourness on the background. Lasting bitter aftertaste.

The most interesting part of this ale for me was the clear (but subtle) traces of cereal (I guess this is the rye) and hay in the finish. Throughout the most prominent taste is of licorice, but also caramel/toffee and resin.

Dark brown/black with a nice and white-brownish head. Small head, but (even though it is smaller) it doesnt disappear.

Sweet, but it is balanced out by a brutal bitterness. The intense kick doesnt last for long, so it doesnt ruin the balance overall and is just an interesting (and tasty) feature of the ale.

Bitter and sweet, with a little acidity to it. The foam ruins the ale a little though, as it seems to be growing in the mouth.

A delicious ale, tastes like how I imagine tar tastes like.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Super good Imperial Porter. Aroma is complex yet clean and enjoyable with tobacco a hint of anise some roast coffee and and a bit of leather. Flavors much like nose, slight sweetness dominates but there is some Carbonic Tang end bitterness to balance making it a very drinkable beer and super smooth period body is very good and finish is perfect.

Versée excessivement huileuse, mousse beige épaisse à bulles fines, brune très foncée avec quasiment aucune transparence... Jolie ! Très beau nez, marqué sur le café Moka, le cacao, le chocolat au lait, la vanille, le bois de cèdre, le caramel, le miel, ainsi que le pruneau, la noix et la noisette, la figue, la banane, la pêche, lananas, labricot bien mûr, la cerise noire... Superbe ! En bouche, alcool de très haute volée qui pousse les flaveurs tant que possible, texture ronde, riche avec énormément de corpulence, sucres résiduels vraiment suaves, amertume sobre parfaitement à léquilibre avec les notes de cacao amer, levures bien droites et aromatiques. Le cuir, le bois, la terre, les notes de céréales et de végétaux, la longueur, un beau final, tout y est ! Cet Imperial Rye Porter est une merveille de douceur et de force à la fois ainsi que de gourmandise. On prend un plaisir énorme à le déguster. Du très grand art de la part de Nøgne Ø et Terrapin. Un must ! Bouteille 33cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.

Épaisse, huileuse et odorante (cacao, grains de céréales brûlés, cendres), elle est presque totalement opaque. Jusque là rien dimpressionnant, mais la bouche est réellement létape où ça commence : intense et moelleuse, mais pas trop, elle présente une belle balance entre les saveurs multiples (chocolat noir, touche de fumé, café en grains, un peu de boisé) et une texture raisonnablement dominée par les malts. Étonnante retenue, et ça lui sert bien au final : le terreux du seigle ressort subtilement, et le buveur nest pas agressé à chaque gorgée.

2017/04/18 - Pours dark brown with a thick, foamy, khaki head that instantly reduces and leaves no lacing. Aroma is toasted bread, roasted coffee, hints of caramel, light licorice, dark chocolate and hints of spicy rye. Taste is sweet caramel and dark chocolate with hints of licorice and alcohol and a toasted bready malt backbone. Mouthfeel is medium to full and oily with smooth carbonation and sweet, toasted, warming finish. Beer is smooth and ABV is present but not overwhelming. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A more or less playbook porter with coffee and chocolate in the foreground and a slightly smoky finish. Hardly any rye character I sensed here.

Lovely bready rye, decent roast level, some dark chocolate, light licorice, noticeable hop kick with some earthy and mold grass impact, bit weird yest. Light sweetness with moderate to light bitterness. Decent and enjoyable, but nothing outstanding,

Bottle from LCBO A: chocolate, light alcohol, lightly spicy, english yeast, light licorice App: dark brown close to black sparing beige head t/p: med to full body with short bitter finish. Soft carbonation. O: This is incredibly smooth. Really enjoy the English feel on this from the yeast. Nicely done.
Great dark color with no head. Slight plums in the aroma, but overall quite dull scent. Sour coffee in the taste ... and thats it. Average ...

Bottle from the LCBO. Opaque mahogany under a tiny tan head that fades quickly to a sheet.Nose is cocoa, dark fruit, coffee, notes of wood and vanilla. Flavour is light sweet molasses with a medium- coffee and dark chocolate bitterness. There is also a light cherry tartness and a touch of spice from the rye. Mouth is medium and silky with soft carbonation. Alcohol is warming but well integrated.

8/4/8/4/16+
Fijne geroosterde smaak met zure tonen. Brood, chocolade en hint koffie. Rond romig warm mondgevoel met exacte plakkerigheid. In mondgevoel ook silky kwaliteit. Afdronk is complex. Suikers.
Pours inky black with a small frothy brown head. Aroma is light roasted malt and hops. Taste is silky smooth, light roasted notes and a touch of rye spice. Very subtle beer with nice nuances.
Bottled. Completely black body, small brown head, very thick. The aroma has prunes, dark chocolate, the taste is cherry, dark chocolate, cocoa, plums and some oak. Good woody finish.

Pours a dark brown colour with ruby highlight. The head is creamy as the lacing, mocha colour, decent lasting. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malts with hints of licorice, pepper and bread. Flavours of licorice, caramel, roasted malts and herbal notes. Very smooth mouthfeel, on the oily side. Wow, this brew is quite something.

500mL Bottle, Tagged 09.08.16: Pours dark chocolate brown with a red edge and a tiny thin fizzy tan head. Aroma of roast, caramel, chocolate, toasty bread, & dried fruit. Mostly sweet, notes of booze and red wine, followed by a bit of roasty bitterness. Silky oil chocolate molasses mouthfeel, soft carb, little bit of a dry finish. Overall: Good, but probably wont go seek another, it just piqued my curiosity and brought back memories of Scandinavian brews seeing it at the LCBO.

500ml bottle. Dark brown with a thin ring of tan foam. Flavors are roasted cereals, pumpernickel bread, molasses, licorice, resinous hops and alcohol with fruity and peppery notes. Full body, moderate carbonation carbonation, oily texture.

Cest noire, obscure, sa petite robe couleur moka cache un secret! Un parfum de noisette, chocolat, un soupçon de café sur des notes vineuses et boisé.

Une entrée remarquable du liquide sous un léger pétillement qui envoye des notes de riche et grasse fondu au chocolat. Cest liquoreux à souhait! Cest sec en bouche. Somptueux et cremeux! Une base riche malté de caramel tendrement grillé. Nous sentons la présence de seigle tout au long de la gorgée! 

Une finale qui rayonne sur un coté fruité cerise et chocolaté qui perdure assez longtemps en bouche!

It pours jet black with brown tinges; the head is caramel-coloured and foamy. The aroma has notes of: leather, cacao, vegetable notes, licorice, and coffee. The taste is medium sweet that finishes medium bitter and dry. The palate is medium-full bodied, creamy and oily; the carbonation is light; the finish is medium. Overall, its got rich deep flavours.

Bouteille 500 ml. Couleur brune-noire, mousse beige, Arôme de grains grillés, chocolat, pain. En bouche wow quelle texture soyeuse, cest doux, gouteux et apaisant. Chocolat, grains, texture. Très Très bon.

Dégustée avec mon cher Appiantiqua dans un verre "3 loups".Belle robe couleur café noir avec une très fine mousse beige éphémère et une carbonatation moyenne.Le nez nous offre des arômes de café et chocolat avec dintenses notes vineuses et fruitées.La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs à limage du nez avec en finale une agréable sensation dalcool très chaleureux.Un excellent Porter!17,5/20

Dégustée avec mon petit Kittenbieer dans un verre "Les 3 Loups".
Température de début 8 à 9 °.
Très belle robe café noir avec une mousse crème très volatile; peu de carbonatation.
Nez particulièrement agréable et dune grande complexité : arômes de café, chocolat, fruits noirs et aussi quelques effluves houblonnées.
Le goût est à la hauteur et dune richesse qui nous donnera envie de revenir à ces subtiles saveurs caractéristiques des grands Porter ou Stout .
Le palais prolonge longuement ces plaisantes sensations.
Une bien belle réussite.

Bottle. Clear dark cola body, minimal mocha head with ok retention. Aroma roasted malt, leather, figs jam, dried berries and handful of spices. Taste is intense and spicy: roasted malts, leather, licorice, burned caramel, black currant jam, dark chocolate, burned nuts and herbs. Lovely.

December 2016 - Bottle picked up from [I cant remember] and shared at Leightons. As Nøgne Ø Imperial Rye Porter, 9%, bottled in 2013, collab with Terrapin. Opaque black with a foamy brown head. Aroma is molasses, spicy, woody, slight papery oxidation. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is chocolate, limestone, dusty, flinty minerals into the finish. OK but maybe in hindsight the age didnt help this one. (3.3)
(bottle) clear, bright, very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of smoked fruit, then jam; thick palate; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish, well hidden alcohol
Rich and creamy pour with roasted coffee and fig newtons in the aroma. A little lighter body than expected, with prominent licorice and a bit of booze at the end.
Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet malty, chocolate. Taste is malty, roasty, chocolate, creamy, bitterish roasty. Alcohol in the finish, otherwise well hidden.

500ml bottle from LCBO. 9% alc/vol. Pours an opaque deep brown colour with one finger of lasting light brown head. Lacing clinging to the side of the glass. Aromas of coffee and bread. Taste starts with a sweet toffee flavour, coffee in the middle and finishes with a well balanced dry and hoppy finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Extremely creamy and unique palate, more creaminess seems to come out of the body while it is in your mouth, astounding. Very roasty character, malts take a long time to show in the aftertaste, definite anise flavour, a bit of a bark type character, a bit of earthy chocolate, nuts. Pours black with dark brown head, dissipates fairly quickly for how dense the head is. Smells a bit boozy but doesnt taste it.. Overall really good.

Pours pitch black with a small beige head. Smells roasty with hints of chocolate and coffee. Taste is roast, coffee, and chocolate. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Nogno Ø/Terrapin Imperial Rye Porter finishes with a silky toasted coconut.

500ml bottle from the lcbo. Black pour, large brown head. Big roast, pine resin hops, soft spice from the rye, and hints of bitter cocoa. Silky mouth feel, soft carb. Finish is medium bitter, with strong licorice notes, anise, fennel and more pine. Sweetness fades and pine rounds everything out, with more roast.
Bottle from LCBO. Thick molasses and dark fruit aroma. Huge grainy and toasty taste that finishes with dark fruits and brandy. Roasty bitterness throughout. Very nice.

Bottle from LCBO. Pours dark as a winters night with a nice ring of brown foam hugging the glass. Well made porter. Somehow manages to be very smooth & yet at times the mouthfeel prickles. Booze at 9% is quite stealthy here. Coffee roast, green hops, drizzles of chocolate. The rye characteristics are not as pronounced as expected. Pretty damn fine.

0.5 bottle. Pours dark brown color with minimal beige head. Aroma of chocolate, bread. Full body, very dense, soft carbonation. Flavor is medium to high sweet, light to medium bitter. Vanilla, chocolate, coffee, dried fruits, licorice. Very rich and complex.

Imperial rye porter, en collaboration avec la brasserie Terrapin des Etats-Unis, où le seigle est roi ..
Niveau abv de 9 %, pour 22° plato, et 30 ebu. Orge et seigle maltés, levure anglaise.
Mon exemplaire, en format 50 cl, avait 20 mois de mise en bouteille, sur 4 ans préconisés par les
brasseurs en date limite.
Couleur noir profond, à lopacité quasi totale.
Mousse en nappage soyeux brun moyen.
Arômes de café, chocolat, froment, pointe très légère de vanille.
1ère bouche très souple, à la très belle entame malt torréfié/café de côte dIvoire, avec de lavoine.
Arrière-bouche dense, profonde, longue, très harmonieuse.
2ème au très grand ensemble malt/café/bois brûlé.
Arrière-bouche riche, tout à fait à léquilibre, magnifique.
3ème aux très belles céréales, très belle saveur brûlée fine.
Arrière-bouche intense, complexe, suave.
Longueur qui développe, travaille, intensifie, nuance .. bref elle fait ce quil faut faire !!
Jambes fines, serrées, longues.
Levure boisée, forte, très belle ligne.
Alcool impeccable, pas du tout excessif, très bien intégré, il développe à la fois saveurs, équilibre 
et harmonie.
Finale remarquable, délicieuse.
CONCLUSION : très grand rye porter en version impériale, ce qui ne gâche rien, avec exactement
les bonnes proportions sur toute la longueur : céréales, force alcoolique, nuances fines, élégance et harmonie.. Du grand art  et un 5 on ne peut plus mérité ...

Aroma: Coffee, dark chocolate, rodenbach, deeds, dark dried fruits, dark berry,hint of caramel Appearance: Dark brown, red glow, almost no see through, medium carb, fine beige foam, medium staying, medium lace Taste: Dark chocolate, coffee, roast, dark berry, light boozy, dark dried fruit, light dry creamy finish

Bottle split at Bespin, thanks to Danny Boyo, 08/12/16.
Black with a decent tan head.
Nose is earthy, molasses, herbal notes, dark chocolate dusting, chocolate biscuit.
Taste comprises chocolate chop cookies, toffee, earthy, shades of fruit loaf, black peppery spice.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent enough porter ... ABV kept in check, drinks fairly easy if perhaps lacking a little depth ABV considered.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Pours dark brown with small, light brown head. Aroma has much of roasted malts, some salty licorice. From the flavor its easy to tell that this beer has high alcohol. Taste has a lot of salty licorice and it even reminds me of some licorice booze. Taste also has roasted malt and some nuts. A bit unpleasant.

500 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a very dark brown with good-sized tan head. Aroma is fairly roasty with chocolate, nuts, some vinous character, dried fruit and some rye spiciness. Flavour has chocolate, roast, prune, red wine, nuts and a gentle peppery rye character. Slick mouthfeel. Good one.

50cl bottle shared at Leightons. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. It pours a dark brown door with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet and rich with notes of chocolate and vanilla. Taste is also rich sweet and lightly funky acidic with notes of red wine and chocolate and caramel. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice one

Bottle at Bierhof Athens. Very dark brown. Coffee, cocoa, a little bit vanilla. Coffee, a little alcoholic, some spiciness, a little dry. Full body, silky texture, full body, a little alcoholic finish with plenty of cocoa and roastiness.

Bottle at Leightons place. 8/12/2016. A dark mahogany brown coloured pour with a loose mid tan head.. Aroma is nutty wood, spicy roast, hint of coffee, rum. Flavour is composed of soy, dusty, airy, dry roasted coffee. Little age. Palate is medium bodied highish carbonation. . Little age.
Tap at Churchkey. Dark dense pour with a small soapy head. Very roasty, rye spice, licorice, hints of chocolate. Slick smooth palate.

Bottle:Literally black with a small and stable off-white foamy layer; dried black fruits, roasted malt and presumably traces of leather in the rich and complex sweet-bitter nose; almost solid bitter-sweet flavour, full bodied and smooth; lingering robust bitter-sweet finish, including dried fruits, again, and besides traces of leather also delicate traces of coffee and vanilla. Very pleasant stuff...
Не понял вкуса, слабый кофе, какая-то кислота. Аромат слабый кофейны&
Mooie donkere porter met een bruine kraag. Vrij dik en vol met.cacao salmiak en trekkend bittere afdronk. Heerlijk
Black, small light tan head. Aroma has roasted malt, chocolate, notes of caramel and dried fruit. Flavour is bitter with chocolate and cocoa and notes of caramel.

Bottle, shared by Mart, thanks! Street tick, so no color or head descriptions. Nose is chocolate, roast, malt notes, licorice and sweet notes. Flavor is roast, coffee, chocolate, licorice. Slightly fruity-hoppy finish, smooth though, on the sweet side. Not bad, some acidity, some fruit, all drinkability.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 Bottle (from etre gourmet?). Pours dark brown-black. Aroma is sweet, sugar, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, rye, spices, malt, roast. Finish is sweet sugar and some bitterness. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: good, but too sweet-sugary.

0,5l bottle at home bought from Ex-De Molen Webshop. Bottled 03.09.2015. BB 03.09.2019. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells of spices, licorice, light yoghurt, bit dusty, nettle, earthy notes. decent smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of licorice, earthy, bitter herbal, nettle, brown sugar, caramel, some chocolate, sherry, light coffee, light oxidation. finishes lightly sweet with notes of sherry, licorice and light caramel. good, has some oxidation (probably could have been fresher anyway) but overall still quite nice. gets a bit mor unpleasant once it warms up. overall good stuff though.
Bottle at home shared among friends. Pours very dark brown with dense, tan head. Rich aroma and taste of liquorice, rye bread, dark chocolate, light chalk, nuts and cookie dough. Long, bitter finish.
Donker bruin bier met een goede beige schuim kraag. Ruikt geroosterd, rogge, koffie. Smaakt zoet, geroosterd, koffie, rogge, zuur toontje.
Mooie zwarte chocolade bruine kleur. Mooie kraag. Ruikt vol, koffie, rogge, vanille. Smaakt vol, vanille, koffie, drop, rogge. Mooie zware afdronk.

A big dense tan head with heavy lacing on a dark brown body. A big rich nose with sweet malt, cocoa, coffee, berries and some chalkiness. This is a big rich imperial porter. Slightly bitter coffee, cocoa, chocolate fudge, plums, dark berries and a touch of rye spice are all present in this dense and rich beer.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Zwart olieachtig bier met mokkakleurige schuimkraag die langzaamaan inzakt. Volle bak koffie en chocolade en beetje vanille in de neus en in de mond. Klein chocolade en koffie-bittertje in de afdronk. Bier perfect in balans. Alweer een topper van Nogne.

Beautiful clear shiney bronze-brown as it pours into the glas and stays a completely dark brown and a small light brown head forms. Subtle toasty aroma with a faint coco and caramel presence. The beer is very dry in the palate. Light sweet and medium bitter taste. The palate is really perfect. Leaves a wonderful dry and toasty sensation in the mouth. Good stuff!

Amazingly balanced beer. Deep dark color. A little hint of bread, ethanol feels just slightly, so you could easily booze yourself out of space without thinking how punchy the beer is. Very recommended
Kivääritehtaankadulla 9/2016. Wonderful, balanced strong beer. Quite dry and roasty.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2016 Pours very dark brown with a minimal tan head, no lacing. Subtle yet rich aroma of chocolate, prunes, dark bread, toffee, coffee. Taste is assertive bitter-sweet, light roasty sourness emerging after a moment. Amazing silky smooth oily texture and full body, light carbonation. Pure bliss! I wish the aroma was stronger though, or perhaps I should drink it at 15-18 C instead of 12 C.
Bottle @ Bierhof, Athens-Greece. Color black with small head. Aroma malt, caramel, chocolate. Taste dark chocolate, roasted, malt, caramel, alcohol.

Musta olut kohtalaisella ja melko pitkäkestoisella beigellä vaahdolla. Tuoksusta on vaikea sanoa ensituntumalta oikein muuta, kuin että se on varsin loistava. Syvän tumma, ruislimppuinen, paahteinen, siirappinen, aavistuksen suklainen kokonaisuus todellakin toimii. Jopa lievää viskisyyttä havaittavissa. Maku pystyy yllättäen tarjoamaan varsin tasavahvan kokonaisuuden tuoksun kanssa. Todella maukkaassa ja monipuolisessa maussa on ruislimppua, paahteisuutta, siirappista sokerisuutta, kevyesti viskisyyttä ja kuivempaa kahviseen taittuvaa humalointia loppupuolella. Pitkäkestoinen jälkimaku on toisaalta siirappisen makea, mutta samalla suolaisemman kuiva. Täyteläinen ja pehmeä suutuntuma. Todella laadukas olut jälleen norjalaisilta.

A big dense tan head with heavy lacing on a dark brown body. A big rich nose with sweet malt, cocoa, coffee, berries and some chalkiness. This is a big rich imperial porter. Slightly bitter coffee, cocoa, chocolate fudge, plums, dark berries and a touch of rye spice are all present in this dense and rich beer.  A touch of vanilla adds to the party.  Smooth, well blended and creamy. Superior
Dark brown/black color. Roasted malt, coffee, cacao, bread, caramel. Dark chocolate taste, caramel, bread, coffee, caramel, a bit spicy. Bitter finish. Well balanced taste.

Guessing this is at least 2 years old. Pours dense black with a quickly dissipating khaki head that settles to a thin ring and leaves a few spots of lace. Nose involves rich dark chocolate, licorice, hints of bbq wood smoke, toast, sawdust and damp wood, raisin, cola. Decently sweet, fairly bitter. Lighter bodied, actually strangely on the thin, very soft toward flat, finishing smoky with a crusty rye bread note. A nice beer, lots of interesting things going on. Palate/mouthfeel is the only let down, and that could be the age showing.
Bottle. Pours black with small brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, liquorice, chocolate... some vanilla too. Almost creamy liquid, cant taste the alcohol. Really good.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2016 Bottle, brewed 03.09.2015. Aroma is intensive dark chocolate, a bit of cherry, wood, alcohol, ash. Black colour with ruby reflexes, brown head that does not stay long. Medium bitterness. Full body, thick texture. Could be more smooth. Very good, but not exceptional.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, dark fruits
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

deep dark brown colour, medium sized, creamy and stable beige head; aroma of herbal liqueur, chocolate-cocoa powder, dried cherry and plum as well as some erthy notes; taste of dark chocolate dried cherry and plum, herbal liqueur and some spicy alcohol; excellent imperial porter

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Nøgne Ø by Imperial Rye PorterRami Rami is drinking an Imperial Rye Porter by Nøgne Ø at PowiśleKawa, palonosc, zbozowosc, kwaskowaty, troche chleba, teoche ciemnych owocow, pelny, ale jednak nie wyroznia sie specjalnieOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Aroma: pralines, choclate, rum, some roasted flavours. Taste: pralines, cherries, choclat, and some hops. Palate: very smooth, well balanced.

Aroma: Chocolate, caramel, roast, cookies, nuts, light cherry which gets stronger with time, metallic hops after pouring to the glass. Appearance: Nice creamy head, black color with light brownish reflections. Taste: Roasty, with some coffee and chocolate, intensive, some caramel, some tobacco bitterness, light soury, light fruits. Palate: Body is full, texture is oily and dense, carbonation is low, finish is sweet.

Kolor:  Ciemnobrązowy. W tym szkle nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Niewysoka, średniopęcherzykowa i drobnopęcherzykowa.
Gruby, trwały dwucentymetrowy kołnierzyk przykleja się praktycznie na stałe do piwa. Wraz ze zmniejszaniem zawartości szkła, kołnierzyk pozostaje wciąż taki sam. Jak pianka na cappuccino. Po dolaniu kolejnej porcji, piana nagle zastyga w bezruchu, tworząc betonową zaporę.
Lacing ponadprzeciętny. W tej kwestii wzorowa postawa. 
 Zapach:  W aromacie przede wszystkim tony baryłek czekoladowych. Mam nieodparte wrażenie jakbym również czuł szczyptę rumu. W drugim podejściu mój nos wyłapuje paloność i odrobinę kawy. 
 Smak:  Fantastycznie zbalansowane piwo. Raz po raz zmienia swój charakter w trakcie degustacji. Raz wydaje się słodkie, potem goryczkowa, a dalej wytrawne. 
Składowe budujące smak to: gorzka czekolada, kawa, baryłki czekoladowe, paloność, odrobina karmelu i orzechy włoskie.
Niesamowita oleistość od żyta. Smaczne, gęste i wyborne.
Alkohol nadaje szlachetnego tonu.
Porter do powolnego sączenia i długiego delektowania się jego smakiem. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Kolaboracyjne piwo Browaru Nøgne Ø z Terrapin Beer Company z Athens w stanie Georgia, USA

Bardzo dobry Imperialny Porter, którego z czystym sumieniem mogę polecić każdemu fanowi craftu.
Nie jest z pewnością najlepszym Imperialnym Porterem jakiego piłem, ale na bank znalazł trwałe miejsce w moim sercu.
To co go wyróżnia w tłumie to: fantastyczna piana, która co ciekawe odbudowuje się przy kolejnych uzupełnieniach szkła i długo utrzymuje się na powierzchni.
Smak, który zmienia się w czasie i mam wrażenie, że w miarę upływu czasu staje się coraz bardziej zaskakujący.
I na koniec żytnia oleistość, która sprawia wrażenie gładkości i kremowości w ustach.
Kropeczką nad "i" jest wspaniały balans poszczególnych składowych.
Mistrzowska kolaboracja!

Bottle. Opaque black color with tanned head. Aroma has chocolate, roasted malt. Taste is malty with long quite bitter aftertaste. Flavors of chocolate, roasted malt, rye and some bitter elements. Very nice balance.

Lots of chocolate, some licorice, quite high roastiness for a porter, some dried fruits in the back. Great texture and body thanks to rye. Medium sweet with good bitterness and roastiness in the finish. Very good beer.

Piana beżowa, nieduża, szybko opada do koronki. Barwa ciemno brązowa. Aromat głównie intensywnej, świeżo palonej kawy, gorzkiej czekolady i morskiej wody, przyjemny i intensywny. W smaku dokładnie to samo, półsłodkie, lekko szorstkie, ziemiste od żyta, kawa, czekolada, paloność idą tu w ścisłej symbiozie z likierowością i mineralnością. Goryczka niska do średniej, alkoholowo palona. W afterteasie śliwka węgierka. Wysycenie niskie do średniego, drobne, szczypiące, lekko wyklejające choć nie gęste w odczuciu.
Poprawny, dość mocno palony mocny porter, może nie wybitny, ale smaczny. Odbiór całości psuje nieco zbyt wyraźny alkohol w posmaku...
Hyvin miellyttävä maku jää tasaiseksi, mutta ei kuitenkaan latistu siemaillessa.

Butelka z datą: 04.04.2019
WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemnobrunatna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, krótka. 
AROMAT: Intensywny. Czekolada, kakao, rodzynki, orzechy laskowe oraz delikatna paloność.
SMAK: Czekoladowe. Lekko słodkawe (karmel). Goryczka niska, krótka. Alkohol dobrze ukryty.
OGÓLNIE: Dobre, bardzo dobre, ale nie wybitne.

Bottle from Firma Bier, batch 1404 brewed 01.03.15 BB 04.04.19, large sample. Dark color, medium frothy brown head. Aroma of lots of chocolate, some dark fruit, bit vanilla, some piney hops, roast, coffee. Medium bitterness, dark roast, some licorice. Quite some hoppy notes as well. Good, but not stunning.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2016 Sampled on several occasions, one of those beers that I love to go back to. Black pour, ruby-tinted, with a very tall tan head with excellent retention. Smells like roasted malts, dark chocolate, cherries, passion fruit, pine. The taste follows the same notes, with an addition of milk chocolate and toffee. Smooth mouthfeel, low carbonation and a fruity chocolate bitter-sweet aftertaste.

Coffee, chocolate in aroma. Pours pitch black with tan head. Taste is medium dry with coffee and roasted malts sourness coutered by chocolate and caramel sweetness. Finish is distinctly bitter, body is medium. Overall very good sipper.

Pours dark with medium light brown head
Aromas of dark rye bread, chocolate, hints of vanilla and coffee, hints of molasses, viol
Taste has milk chocolate, hints of vanilla, rye bread, nougats
Medium bodied and sweet, low bitterness, creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation

Slighty roasted aroma, a slight sourness from the rye, bready, chocolate. 
Pours black with a one finger brown head that sits pretty well. 
Taste is medium sweet with a slight bitterness. 
Medium to full body, oily, soft carbonation and medium finish. 
Overall well balanced between rye breadiness, chocolate and some dark fruit character.
Drank with Marijn and Kaspar during a special night at Marijns parents place 11-2-2016. Very good beer. Thick, RIS-like taste, some sweetness. Lots of body and very comprehensive taste. Loved it.
Pours black colour with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malts. Flavour of roasted malts, bitter hops and coffee. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a roasty, bready and bitter finish. Good stuff .

Aroma of roasted and coffee. Taste is same but with licorice and some chocolate as well. Sweet taste. Full body as always on nøgne with high abv. This is for sure a really good beer. A really, really good one Iam glad I tasted!

50cl bottle from our monopoly. Near black color with small cappucino head. Nose has strong whisky notes with well balanced other delicate aromas like vanilla. Sweet with medium to full body and rounded mouthfeel. Milk chocolate flavours well melted together with some whisky notes. Warming bitter finish. This is excellent brew.
500 ml bottle. Pours black with small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruits, coffee. Full body with soft carbonation. Medium sweet which balanced by a bitter finish. Great beer.
Pours pitch black with a moderate brown head. Roasted, dark chocolate, malty. Moderate sweet and bitter, creamy mouthfeel with notes of roasted malt,chocolate, alchool.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2016 Black with a beatiful brown creamy head. Aroma of whiskey,rye,chocolate, licorice. Taste has rye combined with chocolate, roast and hint of whiskey. Average carbonation, Lightly bitter. Rich and complex, fantastic beer! Well recommended

Couleur noire, mousse qui disparait. Fort nez grain de café, malt noir avec notes caramel,réglisse. Gout de café grillé, chocolat bien cremeux avec une amertume superbe de café torrefiée, en fin de bouche on sent le seigle au palet, voir note tourbée. Corps très cremeux. Fin longue grillée, sucrée avec des notes de réglisse. Superbe!
Overall: Sweet bread, dark fruits, dry ashes, chocolate.Note: Bottle 500 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2015-10-24.

Relatively dark red appearance with no head. Complex tastes coffee, grass, alcohol, licorice and some spruce. Full-bodied, medium carbonation, and a lasting aftertaste of burnt peppers. Quite good porter

October 13, 2015. Bottle at home, brewed september 25, 2014. 
Black with a smal dense brown head, Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, sweet licorice, spicy rye notes, dark chocolate, hints of dried fruits and grassy hop notes. Taste is medium sweet and soft roasted bitter. Finish is medium sweet licorice and dried fruits with hints of warming alcohol, quite soft bitterness with dark chocolate, hints of spicy peppery rye and tobacco notes. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, creamy texture, 
Very enjoyable creamy Imperial Porter with a nice subtle spicy rye note.
My favourite porter. This is a absolutely great porter. Best one i ever tasted

Tallahassee, Fl - ABC Fine Wine & Spirits - 500 ml bottle. Deep, very dark brown leading to a cable black with an initial frothy mocha colored head that thins but sticks around a while. Aroma has some nice licorice accents, some chocolate accents. a touch of rye mintiness. Flavor is full bodied and delicious with some licorice, coffee, chocolate, a back end of rye mintiness. High ABV hidden extremely well. Rich, thick sticky mouthfeel. Extremely solid.

Aroma of sweet malt, rye bread, dark chocolate, some coffee and lots and lots of roasted malt. A great creamy and full bodied porter that has some spice, dark fruits, lots of bitter chocolate, coffee, even got some cherries in it. 

At times it became quite creamy and had some sweeter chocolate, yes milk chocolatey in certain ways which worked very well with the roasted malts and nuttiness that the rye malt gives. As it warms, the fruity and chocolaty elements come to the fore blending very well with some spicy, boozy, nutty flavours.
Ett år gammel flaske. Myk og søt med litt krydret preg. Lett friskhet og mild bitterhet i avslutningen med mer sjokolade. Skikkelig god! Drukket til taco. (26.08.15)

50cl bottle from cerveteca lisboa, portugal. Dark color with thin beige head. Super smooth body. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Aroma is coffee, liquorice, light fruit, herby. Flavour is chocolate, coffee, herbs. Lovely beer.

Aroma has coffee, bitter dark chocolate and vanilla. Alcohol is present. Pours black with a small head that leaves beautiful lacing. Taste has medium bitterness and medium sweetness. Salty licorice, ash. Full body with average carbonation. Long bitter, malty and ashy finish. An excellent beer!

Deep brown to black liquid, outstanding creamy beige to brown head. Its not laces, its a thick ring covering the whole surface of glass. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, american hops, earth, dry fruit. Creamy palate, medium to full body. Alcohol not obvious. The taste is bittersweet with all the notes of aroma present plus brown bread, brandy, portwine. Excellent balance. Smooth and rich. Very nice.

Collaboration between Nögne Ö and Terrapin, with a dense and regularly structured, creamy, yellow beige head and ink black colour, totally opaque at first, but revealing itself to actually be a hazy dark burgundy in the last drops. Pleasant sweet, spicy and malty aroma of warm chocolate sauce with cognac, gingerbread, dried banana, black pepper, rye bread, dried banana, kahlua, pipe tobacco, shortbread, toast, raisins, candied figs, hints of vanilla, red wine, dried grapefruit peel, liquorice, brambleberries, coffee beans, pine needles (i.e. American hops almost like in a black IPA but much more subtle) - something new seems to pop up every time I take a sniff. Tangy onset of condensed candied fruits, dates, raisins, with only a narrow trail of sweetness, paired with a deep rye sourishness and spiciness, soft carbo with a very creamy, velvety, thick body, flowing into the throat like fresh cream; a liquorice-like flavour plays somewhere in the middle, over a deep, thickly layered malt backbone, caramelly in the most noble sense of the word, nutty, bitter chocolatey and lightly coffeeish in the end, with just a dash of bittering espresso on the back of the tongue, further reinforced with peppery, piney, dried citrus peel hop bitterness, lingering fruitiness and warming, brandy-like alcohol; the overall impression is very malty but deeply, softly spicy as well (likely the rye effect mixing with the hops), with a perfect balance between sweet and bitter. Smooth, clean, pleasantly warming and technically perfect imperial porter.  I am not yet familiar with Terrapins beers, but the Nögne Ö quality stamp is unmistakably there.

Le liquide a lapparence dune huile à moteur usée lorsquon le verse dans un verre. Une mousse brune paresseuse le recouvre. Les odeurs sont de grains grillés, de mélasse, de vanille avec des élans épicés. Les saveurs sont de lait au chocolat, de garnitures de carré aux dattes et dherbes variées. Bizarrement, toutes ces particularités; arômes et flaveurs, sont sourdes et étouffées, comme si elles étaient intimidées par la viscosité du liquide. Cest une belle caresse au gosier. (Batch 1275) (230515)

500 ml bottle from BierKompass. Pours black with a nice brown head. Aromas of chocolate at first with some spiciness and maybe dark fruits. Taste is really nice with chocolate and dark malts at first, spiciness and hoppy notes following. Medium body with medium carbonation.

Bottle. Almost black color with thin beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dry plums. Taste is lightly sweet with mild bitter finish. Oily texture. Full-bodied. Finish is long, roasty. Nice porter!

From old notes. From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012. Black color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, caramel, chocolate, fruity. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation

the aroma of caramel, chocolate, port, toffee and dried fruits... the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of chocolate, toast, red wine, plums and some spices... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste...

Bottle 0.5 l. Dark brown color with good tan foam. Aroma: hoppy, flowers and vanilla, rich malts, roasted, burnt, black bread with raisins, prunes and a good port wine. Taste: smooth, gentle warming, malt sweetness, chocolates, a little rye sourness, piecrust, raisins, prunes and dried apricots, wine and brandy. Powerful and delicious.

500ml bottle from Den Nordiske Ølhandel Copenhagen. Black, creamy tan head. Herby aroma, juniper, fennel, toffee, mushrooms, forest. Creamy, thick mouthfeel, smooth in the mouth. The taste is sweet licorice, juniper, spices, toffee, anise, roasted rye. Warming pleasant aftertaste, theres little sweet vanilla at the finsih. Several tasty flavors in great balance.
Tap.Pitch black colour with small beige head.Aroma of vanilla and slight burnt wood,even roasted and rich malty with good note of chocolate and rye,well balanced and full body.

Pours deep black with thin brown head. Nose is mostly roasted malts and chocolate, with something milky. Aromas are roasted malts, coffee, black chocolate, dark fruits, liquorice, pepper and alcohol. Kind of a milky sweetness. Thick texture, full body, medium carbonation. Long bitter and roasted finish, balanced by sweetness. Very great and perfectly balanced imperial porter!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
How: Bottle Appearance: Jet black, small tan head. Aroma: coffee, liquorice, dark chocolate, dark berries and vanilla. Palate: Full body, smooth carbonation.
Ibnteresting and storng in taste as Nogne beers always. NOt as watery as regular Terrapin ones but still good.
Pitch black and creamy porter. Mostly chocolate and dairy in the aroma. Great mouthfeel. Very good balance, more to the sweet and chocolate. Rye goes out well in the finish. Great beer.

500ml bottle from alesela. Pours oily jet black with a thick tan head. Aromas of strong coffee, liquorice and tar. Taste is more tar, coffee, rye, dark chocolate sweetness. Rich, oily texture, full body. Sweet finish.
Big n sweet... nice fierce rye, chococaramel.. some bitters... a bit too sweet in the back

Black with thick, cream coloured head. Really smooth and thick oily texture. Some dark, dried fruits. Sweet chocolate and a touch of bitter coffee and tar that linger in the aftertaste. Quite sweet overall for a Porter.

Pours that dark porter/stout black with a small dark tan head. Aroma of dark fruit, booze and roasted malts. Taste is of sweet dark fruit with no hint of booze really good. Overall I like this porter, is does have a best buy on the label but there is no date so?

500 ML bottle

Dark cola pour, settled black, great dark brown sugar colored head, excellent retention with strips of lacing. 
Nose is sweet licorice, sweet milk chocolate, roast, coffee, subtle spice, caramel and vanilla. 
Lots of vanilla sweetness up front. Subtle earthiness in the back. There is coffee, caramel, grain, roast, and bitter licorice root and spice. Very sweet though. 
Medium bodied, light carbonation, full on sweetness. Interesting enough once get through the sweetness.
Very roasty with light coffee notes and cereal. A pretty straight forward Porter done fairly well.

Bottle. Dark brown, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate to full, malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel and roasted malt, light licorice and coffee. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel and light roasted malt, light licorice and coffee. Finish is average to long, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish, light caramel and some roasted malt with light coffee, faint licorice and light hoppyness. Caramel sweetish IP with roastiness makes the finish bit drier. Way too sweet for me.

Best before 22/03/2016. Pours a really dark brown and almost black. On top sits a small beige rim that doesnt leave much lacing. Nose is of roasted malt, slight peppery rye or alcohol and green hops. Taste is rich with some dry cocoa, coffee and a light lactose-like sweetness. Alcohol is pretty much completely hidden. Body is full and carbonation low to moderate. Overall a really solid imperial porter, nice after supper drink!

Bottle. Dark with large brown creamy head. Aroma first surprisingly hoppy, then adds chocolate, coffee - rather complex. Massive lacing. Full body. Sweet taste: coffee, dark chocolate, dried plums; finish more on the bitter side. Very nice overall.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50 cl bottle from Etre Gourmet cons 2015-03-19 Duved
AR: roasted malt, chocolate and coffey
AP: black, frothy dark brown head
F: roasted malt, chocolate and coffey, big smooth body, lasting flavors, My wife asked me to by another, so it must have been good ;)

(Nøgne Ø / Terrapin Imperial Rye Porter) Bottle 500 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 9%
Totally black and thick pour, minimal dark brown head that builds up though, still with low retention. A thin line of lacing around the glass.
Aroma has alcohol, vanilla, chocolate, light roasted character.
Taste has also roasted malts, a bit pf ash on the finish, vanilla, notable alcohol.
Medium thick body, good carbonation, dry and sticky at the same time on the palate.
Great beer, not much difference from a well made imperial stout, I could drink this the whole day.
Draft. Brown pour. Slight hint of oxidation and soy, oatmeally rye with some cocoa and roast but not heavy.

Bottle. Pours dark black, opaque, small tan head that dissipates quickly leaving solid lacing. Rich chocolate, roasted malt and anise aroma. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter, roasty, dark cocoa, some anise, a bit of lightly burned malts. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours black, nose is toffee, chocolate, roasted, taste is similar, peppery, bitter.

BOTTLE 50 CL. Medium intensity aroma of roasted malts, vanilla sweetness, some fruitiness that does not last long, chocolate and black malts, some salty smokiness? The flavour, on the other hand, is quite bold, well roasted (but not over the top), vanilla sweetness is kept well behind the hop and roast bitterness. Warming and spicy alcohol, but no proper aroma or taste of it. It is pretty much in line with Nognes own imperial stout, albeit a little more subdued. Not sure where the rye is behind all this roast. Not min-blowing, but still, very well done.

500 ml bottle, slow mo gusher. Hueless darkest brown, fading mocha foam. Aroma of dark roasted malt and black licorice. Heavier dark roast taste, sweet chocolate, spicy rye, black licorice. Soft carbonation, full bodied, moderately hopped. Tasty Imperial stouter porter. DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys)
Bottle 50cl. White layer disappearing. Dark brown color. Aroma is berries, light leahter, prunes and old shoes. Taste is sweet of tar, rye and a bit dirt.

Bottle.2 times drink and tastes were very different one - gorgeous soft porter with coffee and rye notes. The second - very bitter, sharp porter with a mild flavor and uninteresting taste. Estimation of the average of the total.

Aroma: fruity, sweet chocolate, very complex, yeasty.
Taste: again sweet and fruity, plums, chocolate. 
Very complex and tasteful.

Really dark brown colour with beige head on top. Aroma has berries, roasted malts, coffee and some rye. Taste has rye, roasted malts, berries and coffee. Strangely there is this kind of acid flavour which is quite unpleasant. Full body and light carbonation.
Black like music or oil from Norway. Nicely roasted. Oh my rye. Not too sweet nor heavy. Great.

Only a short review for now:
Pours a pretty straight black
Very nice aroma and thick body, good taste, only a tad too sweet.
Chocolate, liquorice, baltic rye bread, caramel. Minimal brown head, soft carbonation.

Black body, luscious rich, inviting and special. Lovely soft dark malt aroma, like quality sourdough loaf, rich milk chocolate, pine trees, damp forest and sweet rye bread. Mouth filling, dark sweetness, enough hop backup. Very fulfilling and of the highest standards. Absolutely gorgeous beer. (50cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2017 0,5 l w KiK. Jedno słowo wystarczy do określenia powyższego piwa - WSPANIAŁE. Najlepszy Porter jaki miałem okazję pić. Polecam!



Butelka. Zabutelkowane 31.03.2015 r. Piana beżowa drobna niewysoka, szybko znikająca. Aromat intensywny palony, gorzkiej czekolady, orzechów, ciemny owoców. W smaku mocno palone, orzechowe. Pojawiają się posmaki związane z utlenieniem. Konsystencja pełna, oleista, lekko wyklejająca. Alko super ukryty. Patrząc z perspektywy czasu oraz degustacji kilkunastu wysokiej klasy piw ocena 4.6 jest mocno przeszacowana. Nie zmienia to faktu, że piwo jest wysokiej klasy. Bardzo smaczne.

 
Ocena: 4.2

Bottle. Completely black with a small tan head. The aroma consists of roasted malts, rye bread, caramel, chocolate and a hint of liquorice. This beer is highly sweet, moderately bitter and has a bitter finish.

Great pitch black colour, little to no head. Great whiskey, licorice, wood, smoky nose. Also some raisin and sour cherry. Fantastic taste, very round yet bitter, perfect balance. Just a little bit too sweet, just a little, not much... Other than that an amazing beer!

Bottle, from Spiegelau stout glass. Big brown head. Deep black. Strong, warming, complex and very tasty. Roasted malts, rye pudding, liqourice. Aroma has coffee, raisin, plum, chocolate and dark malts. Bitter aftertaste. Full and filling palate.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Nogne Imperial Rye Porter is a rich black brown brew with a thin head of medium brown bubbles. The nose is Rich roasted malt, dark chocolate and a crisp floral hops over all of it. Taste is creamy and crisply sweet over a rich malt base of toasted caramelized grains. Finishes with good roasted chocolate flavor. body is somewhat creamy and fluid. very nice beer.

Pullo Alkosta. Kaattu snifteriin sysimustana ja melko paksuna, noin sormen vahvuisen vaahdon suojaamana. Tuoksussa päällimmäisenä on suklaisuus, jonka seurana on vahvaa maitokaakaota sekä salmiakkia. Alta tulee hieman rukiin omaan nenään hieman hapan viljaisuus. Moniulotteinen tuoksu. Maussa rukiin hapan viljaisuus ja mausteisuus tulee selvemmin esiin, nyt kaakao ja suklaa ovat taustalla, vaikka lopussa nousevat enemmän esiin. Jonkin verran tiettyä tammisuuttakin on mukana. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen, lähes pureskeltavan öljyinen ja keskiasteisesti humaloitu ja pitkään kestävä. Upean tuoksun jälkeen maun liika rukiisuus oli lievä pettymys, mutta hyvä imperial porter on kuitenkin kyseessä. Ruis tuo omasta mielestä tuhtiutta runkoon ja näin vahvaan olueen tuo täyteläisyys sopii oikein hyvin.

Bottled. Black beer, creamy mocha head. Syrupy malt aroma, spicy rye bread, slight smokiness, light fruitiness. Slick, rich maltiness, some dark chocolate, spiciness of rye. Bready roastedness. Full bodied, silky smooth texture, low carbonation. Good stuff.

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 3 Oct 2014) Black colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of strong black coffee, cacao, liquorice and dark rye bread. Malty, roasted taste with black coffee, dark chocolate, liquorice, crisp-bread and a generous roasted coffee bitterness in the finish. Almost full body, with a certain sweetness. The rye adds a slight spiciness to this imperial porter. Lots of taste, solid and quite powerful, but still in very good balance. Excellent beer!

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2015 Rerate (6.11.2015): 50 cl, bottled. BB 03.09.19. Brewed 3.9.2015. Pours dark with a decent tanned head. Aroma: Some roasted malt, cocoa, old potatoes, butter. Ryeish tones. Taste: Medium sweet, notable bitterness. Pleasantly malty, buttery and creamy feel in mouth. Very balanced. Old earthy potato flavours. Soapy tones. Palate: Medium body, medium carbonation. Not bad. Soapy flavours in aftertaste. No score changes (6.11.2015, 6-3-6-4-12).
-----
50 cl, bottled. Pours black with a tanned head. Aroma: Fruity sweet, malt. Taste: Lingering sweet, slightly acidic (weird). Pleasant burnt bitterness. Malty, rye. Palate: Medium-full body. Decent porter, tries too much. (1.8.2015, 6-3-6-3-4-12)
Ihmeellinen metsän aluskasvillisuus maussa. Hyvä alku, kitkerä loppu. Jotenkin hyvä, mutta vain jotenkin.

[6841-20141009] 1pt.9floz bottle. Sweet barrel wooden aroma. Black body with a quick foamy light tan head. Hoppy roasted plum fruit flavour. Full body. Delicious, very drinkable. (8/4/9/4/17) 4.2
(w/ blankboy, HogTownHarry, jercraigs)
Overheard: "Im willing to bet my boomerangs were better than yours."

Looks like a perfect porter and smells like one. Taste is heavily roasted malt, dried fruit, coffee, a decent bit of booze and I swear a bit of rye spiciness. Palate is heavy like a stout. Not your typical porter, and very good.

Bottle from Drinkstore, Dublin [211214]
Pitch black, beige head, good lacing
Aroma - Dark deep rich malts, some soft spicy malt in there, slight alcohol, some dark fruits, soft spicy hops, very vague citrus in there
Taste of rich dark malts, very mellow roast, some dark fruity chocolate, some soft spicy malts, quite complex rich malts, soft fruity spicy hops under the malts, easy for the abv
Palate - Soft carb, full body, very smooth, fairly sweet, good mouth feel. Finish as main flavour, more fruity spicy malts, smooth, bit of tangy light acidic fruit, perhaps a hint of citrus in the finish
Overall - Very good porter, fruity, soft spicy, easy going
Bottle 50 cl. Pours black with nice tan brown head. Notes of licorice, chocolate, salty licorice, wood, espresso, coffee, nuts, roasted. Very smooth with great taste and goes down very easy.

Dark brown, bit cloudy pour, black in glass, creamy / frothy head is light brown, bout one finger and medium long, gives good lacing rings, looks good. Sweet aroma with hints of medicinal herbs, salty licorice, regular coffee, bit syrup, nice roasting, hoppy bitterness is there also. Nicely nuanced and tempting aroma. Chocolate follows and rye. Full and round, sweet and roasted medium bitter, long roasted finish, I would say medium bodied even tough it feels quite filling and full, almost oily. Nuanced and well flavored beer, great palate, one that inspires to analyze. Thank You Nogne, enjoyed :)

500 ml bottle
Dark brown, almost black beer with little ruby red on the sides. Thick light brown head. Aroma has roasted malts, light smoke, dark chocolate, dark fruits, pine and rye bread. Flavor is roasted with chocolate, toffee, coffee and bitterness. Palate is thick with quite heavy carbonation. Finish has medium bitterness and some alcohol. Aftertaste is dry roasted and coffee acidic with herbal hops, licorice, dark chocolate and toffee. Decent stuff.

50cl bottle. Dark brown colour with a thin tan head. Dark chocolate, dried fruits, spices, light caramel, light liquorice and alcohol in the aroma. Soft to average carbonation and medium to full body. Taste is bittersweet, well balanced with a long dry finish. Overall, a very good beer indeed.

Bottle. Black oily beer, came slowly out of the bottle, beautiful. Smooth aroma of cacao, malt and vanilla. Taste is soft and velvet, with notes of cacao, some bitter licorice, rye and a coffee finish. Oily mouthfeel, thick body. Nice dry and bitter aftertaste. Very good.

Pours an opaque black with a big frothy brown head that leaves rings of lace up the glass. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, cocoa, spicy rye malts, light alcohol and coffee. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee light bitter cocoa with a pleasant spicy rye character that mingles well with the alcohol warmth on the finish and a nice prickly tingly feeling on the tongue. Great beer with just a bit too much alcohol but otherwise great!

Pours a nearly opaque dark brown, a massive brown head with a ton of lace. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate and mildly bready. Flavour is roasted malt, cocoa, mildly bitter(roast malt/coffee like bitterness), coffee, lightly spicy rye and a touch bread(basically Tastes like rye bread.

Rating #1056 - April 11, 2014 -Bottle from CBI, #beerguychrisgeekbeer for #week14. Aroma is heavy roast malt,lots of coffee, chocolate. Taste is mild bitterness, medium-heavy alcohol character. Really cool porter, which has some citrusy-vanilla rye notes and that hint of Nogne smokiness which is delectable. Phenomenal.

In short: A very sweet and highly roasted black ale with spiciness and moderately rye presence. If you have a sweet tooth.
How: Bottle 500ml, consumed 2.5 year before expiration date.
The look: Brown-black body topped by a medium tan head with medium retention.
In long: Nose is burnt cereals, a certain spiciness (no specific spice), some rye, some smoky notes reminiscent of smoked almonds. Nice mouthfeel with a full body that is lighten up by an active lively carbonation. Taste is on the sweet side. Lots of husky grainy burnt malts, a slice of rye bread, a lot of residual sugars, roasted nuts, chocolate cake icing, a peppery-ish spiciness, a sip from an cup of old cold coffee. Sweeter and heavier than expected from a 9% porter. The massive sweetness finds opposition in a astringent bitterness coming froth the high roasted level. Just too sweet for me, very low drinkability here. A well made beer that just didnt work for me, doesnt score very high on my hedonistic scale. Im rating this one against the grain, and now people will think Im joking around on ratebeer but truth is ratebeer is my serious account, my ridiculous one is my bank account.

On tap @ SOLO Birra Monza. Marrone scuro opalescente. Schiuma beige fine e persistente. Aroma tostato, caffè, cioccolato, liquore, frutta rossa sotto spirito (ciliege), frutta secca (nocciole e mandorle, molto complesso ed intrigante. Gusto abboccato, quasi amabile, liquore al caffè, nocciola, tostatura elegante. Corposa, calda, poco carbonata, rotonda ed equilibrata.

Ok, I may not be the right guy to rate this beer because Im not a porter guy. Nose is complex with woods and alcool. A fait amount of bitterness is expected here as well wich you loose at tasting. The liquid os dark and opaque. The foamy head is really what I prefer from this beer. In my opinion this beer has nothing from a porter in termes of taste and palate. The whole thing smells and taste like beer added with rye.
This Porter is like a piece of coffee chocolate in your mouth. Its quite expensive yet wore every penny you spent
It poured a black color with a tan head. The aroma was of malt, grain, chocolate and coffee. The taste was of roasted malt, grain, chocolate, licorice and coffee. Good stuff.

Bottle, Ship in a Bottle, West Kirby. Black pour with a small tan head. Nose had some roasted malt, rye, chocolate, molasses and burnt toast. Fullish mouthfeel. Flavour was similarly roasty with some spice, and dark fruit alongside some hop bitterness. Pretty satisfying and a decent collaboration.
0.5L bottle at home, black beer with a small head, aroma malty and coffee and hops. Taste is hops, malts, bit sweet. Very very nice beer.

[Bottle (500ml) shared with HogTownHarry, jercraigs & mabel -- c/o j&m] Pours a very dark brown with an average size lasting frothy beige head and a good amount of lacing. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, vanilla, alcohol, light hops and fruit. Somewhat bitter finish. Average bodied. Good, not great.

2014-10-09. Black body with a nice brown head that fades. 3+ Aroma is fairly alcoholic up front. Some dark malt. Flavour is fairly bitter, pleasantly so. Good amount of hops? Light spicey touch might be the rye as per the name but I dont immediately identify it as such. Lingering alcohol has a lightly herbal quality to it. Average plus bodied palate, modest carbonation . 3+ Solid, it grows on me. Bottle via trade with Duffman
Overheard:"Why are you writing kangaroo porn?"Somebody has to!

Barril en cerveceria The Drunk Monk - Mataró (Spain) Vierte color negro intenso con media capa de espuma beige de buena retención; aromas marcados a maltas tostadas, café, regaliz y chocolate negro, entrada media con amargor moderado y muy equilibrado, trago corto con cuerpo medio y carbonatación baja, pos gusto maltoso y largo; una interesante y bien balanceada cerveza.
A delightfully smooth and nuanced imperial porter with notes of cocoa and earthy coffee. Extremely smooth/silky. Fantastic and I dare say underrated beer, better than the Biscotti Break series imo.
Great imperial rye porter. Very creamy body. Perfectly balanced. Coffee taste and some chocolate

0.5 litre bottle from Glavpivmag in Moscow. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Roasted malt and coffee aroma. Taste of chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, coffee. It's a nice beer but I don't know this style well enough to give a qualified rating.

Draft @ Stone Liberty Station. Aroma is roasty, a little piney & earthy. Opaque black color. Taste is a little boozey, nice roast, & a little earthy. A lot of flavors going on. Full bodied. Very nice beer!

September 9, 2014 - shared by J&K with me and blankboy. 500ml bottle. Clear deep ruby with a smallish beige head. light roast, sweet slightly boozy, very fruity. Taste has more alcohol, no rye character, spicy, quite weird. Average body, stinging carbonation, some deep roast in the finish. Whatever.

Bottle. Lightly smoky/lactic chocolate, rye malt, and pine aroma. Black with minimal head. Sweet dark chocolate, rye malt and moderately bitter herbal pine flavor. Body lighter than expected. Very good.
Sample @ SBWF. Unusually fruity porter with notes of vanilla and chocolate. Sweet and smooth. Good dessert beer.

"Its been a while since I had a Nogne O porter and I had forgotten how good their dark roasty beers can be. Wonderful malted chocolate and roasted malt aroma with some earthiness and spice in there as well. The flavor is not quite as complex, but the rye is a really nice touch."

Bottle:
Thick, oily black with a heavy tan head.
Rye and chocolate, smoke aroma..........dark fruit.
Taste is bitter-sweet raisin, coffee, chocolate...
Roasty, lightly smokey, cocoa, earthy/peppery/rye malt....
Very complex and really tasty.
Excellent.
Thanks Tony! Slick near black, with small tan head. Aroma is chocolatey,. Taste is fruity, dark chocolate, caramel, rye I guess. Pretty nice!

Bottled 500ml. -Courtesy of Marcos friend, shared with him and Marko. Pitch black coloured, small to medium sized pale brown head, roasty nose with whiff of alcohol. Roasted malt, chocolate, licorice and alcohol with mild fruity notes. Rather dry sweetish finish.
Duft av frukter, kaffe og sjokolade. Dyp sort farge. Tynt brunt skum, ring langs kant. Nydelig smak av sjokolade og frukter som sitter.

Pours black with tan head. Aroma is chocolate, licorice, caramel, coffee and spice. Slick palate. Aftertaste is round, sweet, bitter licorice and dark chocolate. Overall: Very nice. The rye creates a nice spiciness to this Nordic porter.

Aroma: 7/10. One big note of chocolatey-roast malts. Not complex, but wonderfully evocative, intense aroma. Yum.

Appearance: 5/5. Pours a nice black with a thin yellowey-tan head and long lacing down the glass.

Taste: 10/10. Wow. Just the right sour up front, sweet in the middle, and chocolate-coffee-ash in the back. A great licorice-ey finish that then goes to a strong coffee-chocolate-metallic-bitter-hops thing. I can barely put this down and I want the next sip.

Palate: 4/5. The finish is a little too intense on the hops for my tastes, but thats the only fault I can find. Body is great, silky-smooth and great on the tongue. A little astringency that lingers and burns. 

Overall: 17/20. Wow. What a beer. This is easily the best porter Ive ever had. I havent been entirely moved by Nognes offerings in the past, but this is a champion beer, right here.

Coffee, nuts, chocolate and wood in the aroma. Black with a tan head. Medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter. Full body with a soft carbonation. Overall a fantastic Imperial Porter, well balanced, well hidden alcohol, and very smooth on the palate.

Enormous thanks to Nikola for bringing it from Norway and sharing with us! Poured a blackish brown body with an off white head. The aroma is complex, oily, malty, some (rye) whiskeyish notes - alcohol, orange liqueur... Slightly smoky taste, bacon, rye, orange liqueur, a bit fresh, light roastiness, full creamy body, lovely citric note, a superb, tasty beer marred by a light note of alcohol, perhaps, though Im sensitive to that. Again, great job!
Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is malt, roastiness, caramel, chocolate, liquorice and rye. Taste is high sweet leading to a roasty finish. Nice.
Bottle. Pours very dark brown, tan head. Nose is licorice, powdery chocolate. Flavour is spicy rye, dark chocolate, wood, no alcohol. Silken mouthfeel.

Aroma:Dark chocolate,fudge,raisin...
Appearance:Dark good beige head...
Flavor:dakr chocolate,rosted malt...

On tap @ In De Wildeman. Almost black color. Short light beige head. Aromas: roasted malts, cola. Retronasal theres lots of chocolate, roasted malt, berries/cherries (dark red fruit), something undefinable ??? Flavor is moderate sweet, chocolate, light mocha. Body is medium to full. Velvetty mouthfeel. Finishes with lots of roast and moderate bitter. Not always a fan of berries/cherries flavor in dark beer but this was well done.
Poured deep dark brown with a dense beige head. Aroma of alcohol soaked raisins, roast malt and dark chocolate. Full body, flavour much as the aroma, fudge and lots of berries.
Grosse mélasse chocolatée et onctueuse qui cache très bien son alcool. Une infusion houblonnée ajoute également de la complexité et une finale fruitée.

500 ml bottle thanks to Kevin. Pours a pitch black color with a medium beige head. A dark malty nose, chocolates, anise, some rye. The flavor is wonderful: dark German rye bread, some chocolate, dark fruit, smoke, spicy at times, loads of bitter dark chocolate. Home run! There is a load of barrel character in this really (is it BA?). Sweet, mellow round flavors. Very good.

On tap at Frisco Tap House & Brewery in Columbia, MD. 

Opaque, near black with a thin light tan head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of dark fruit, chocolate, roasted malt, licorice, toffee and rye spiciness. 

Taste of roasted malt, dark fruit, charcoal, vanilla, sweet mocha, licorice and pumpernickel. 

Medium body and medium/high carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Well this is an incredible beer! The aroma is sweet and spicy, fruity and of chocolate. Pours as a thick black vessel with a cascading yet restrained brown sugar coloured head which dissipates to a thin ring around the glass. Tastes sweet and peppery with full chocolate malt character, smooth earthy hop notes and a lasting rich fruity malt finish. Full bodied with a thick oily texture that makes this like velvet on the tongue. Overall this is a truly decadent beer, rich and smooth and very complex, incredible!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Sticky black with a thin tan head. Aroma is strong fruity malt. Flavour is sticky rye, velvet texture. Toasted chocolate on a spicy finish.

Noir très sombre avec une grande mousse marron. Larôme du malt torréfié, vanille, chocolat, chêne, seigle et du levure. Le goût est dabord du chocolat, vanille et chêne. Ensuite, cest du café et malt torréfie avec une finition dune amertume moyenne. Un palais un peu onctueux mais avec assez carbonatation que ce nest pas épais. Super bonne!

Pitch black beer with a pretty solid tan head, leaves some lacing. Complex aroma: chocolate, coffee dark malts. Taste: sweet, slightly smokey alcohol, bitter fenolic Moutfeel: soft, a bit oily, effervescent. Although it appears a bit too sweet in my opinion, still a excellent and well-brewed beer.

BOTTLE (BATCH#1086) Poured very black with a big thick tan head. Got nothing but sticky pudding, caramel from the nose & taste, very thick body to go with it... Good one to finish on...
sourced from Cellarbrations Capel

bottle sample from the nogne o stall at braukunst live in munich 2014. dark brown with a thin sliver of a head; salty aroma, pumpernickel, some citric hop character; pleasant salty dough, play-do flavours, decent whack of bitterness
Very nice porter with strong cola aroma. Also some coffee. A bit smokey too. Solid and good beer. Probably Norways best brewery. Not cheap either. This one was about 11$ in Norway.
50 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a little sediment and a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, milk chocolate, pine, and citrus - with a bitter finish.
Draught. Soft notes of nuts and chocolate. Porter notes and rye recognizable but generally a bit flat taste. Velvety and oily texture, well hidden alco. Nice for beginning imperial porter road.
On tap at Chmielarnia, Warsaw, Poland. Very delicaye imperial porter. Vanilla, milk coffee, nuts. Texture very oily and full bodied. Alcohol very well hidden. Very drinkable.

Black, ruby reflexes, small beige foam; coffee, dark fruits aroma; medium sweetness, medium bitterness; full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long bittersweet finish;
Overall: great beer, balanced, tasty

Bottle - 500ml at Mondial de la Bière (Montréal, QC). Opaque black body with a thin beige foamy head. Robust malty/hoppy aroma with woody, licorice, chocolate, and spicy hints. Taste is slightly dominated by hoppy flavors. It carries oaky, yeasty, vanilla, and fruity notes. Ends with a long, warming bittersweet finish. Fantastic!

Bottle. Pours Black with a small Brownish head. Aroma of roasted malt and cafe creme. Roasty sweet flavour with a bitter hoppy finish. Very nice. Rye always seems to gice a slightly unusual element to dark beers. Like fennel seeds in a loaf of bread.
Black pour with tan head. Intense roasted nose with some spice and dark berries. Flavour has burnt chocolate, anise and a big spicy finish with alcohol warmth. Nice.
Lovely rye edge, flavourful porter. Wonderful drinkability. Opaque black. Worth seeking out.

Bottle. Close to pitch black beer with a strong light brown head. The aroma is roasted with some maltiness, and the flavour is gently bitter and roasted with a creamy maltiness. Overall a nice strongly flavoured dark beer with roasted and creaminess.

Deep brown to black color with red hue, light brown head. Coffee nose, roasted malt, liquorice, hints of red berries, wood and alcohol. Coffee, chocolate and roasted malt taste, hint of alcohol. Complex and long lasting. Full body, oily and velvety texture, warming alcohol.

50cl bottle from Discount in Milwaukee. Continues to be the standard-bearer for Milwaukee area craft beer stores! Served colder than cellar temperature. Pours a very, very dark brown with a brown head leaving some streaky lacing. Aroma has dark chocolate, espresso, chocolate liquour, some hoppy grassy/grain. Further in the glass, some caramel comes in strongly.Taste is of chococoffee, liquid chocolate, that dry grainy rye flavor and some caramelly malt. Medium to full bodied, and rich and smooth. Finishes quite long and a touch to the sweet side of bitter-sweet with the liquid chocolate & caramel taking top billing at the end. Nicely dry presence from the rye and certainly roasty bitterness. A fine offering from 2 very solid "dark brew" brewers.

Super, and I mean SUPER, creamy. Seriously as thick as old motor oil. Kind of sticky. Light, crisp carbonation. Drying with a nice roasted bitterness. Taste delivers dark, sweet fruits up front. Big chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, toffee, coffee, and a little licorice follows. Creamy chocolate is the boss of this beer, but its other parts compliment it wonderfully. Beautifully balanced. Hoppy tropical fruit flavor pops in and out as it warms.

(bottle - 500 ml) Black pour with a thick tan head. Huge roasty aroma with some nice bitter hints of coffee and rye toast. Flavor is smooth and roasty at the start and keeps that way throughout. Finishes slightly dry from the rye but has a nice lingering bitter bite.

Botella de 50 cl en el lúpulo en el momento en 06-05-2014. Lote 1086 de 05-12-2013 hasta 05-12-2017. color negro intenso con espuma algo oscura, sabores tostados y maltosos intensos, con un amargo final no muy intenso. Cuerpo medio con 9 vol bastante buenos. Para repetir sin problemas.

Man what a great imperial porter. Takes me back to the first one I ever had. Aroma was so so. Deep dark chocolate with just a hint of coffee. Pour was a think ink back with a thin tan ring for a head. Taste was delicious. Strong dark chocolate with heavy black licorice flavors. Very big flavor. Strong bitter dark chocolate with the rye coming out in the finish. It was just enough to be noticed and not overpowering. Medium carbonation. Cant say enough about this one. Great for the style and in general
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Poured very dark black with a dark brown head. Coffee, burnt sugar, toasted bread and a nice herbal aroma and flavor do a number on your senses. Thick, smooth mouth feel. We just started seeing them in Ohio and cant wait to try more of their stuff
On draft at ChurchKey DC. Creamy body. Nutty coffee flavor that I moderately enjoy. A bit astringent.
On draft at ChurchKey DC. Pours black with a tan head. Light roasty nose. Flavors of licorice with a hint of tobacco. Full bodied and rich with a smooth, velvety finish. Nice.

Poured jet black with thick mocha head. Sweet aroma with toasted malt and coffee. Rich in taste; coffee, pepper, mollases, dark chocolate, rye. Nice bitterness. Need to pick up another bottle, really good porter!

4oz pour at Churchkeys Nogne O Tap Takeover. Pours an inky black with some thick, brown head. Nose has some toast, black pepper, molasses, mild smoke, caramel. Flavor is malty, toast, a little black pepper, molasses, mild coffee, brown sugar. Full bodied, dry, toasty finish.

Very good, better than the prototype version. Some caramel, booze, chocolate. Classic in taste despite the rye. Finishes light bitter with some sweetness. Dark brown/black with ok head and lacing. Tap at Churchkey.

Draft at Churchkey for a meet the brewer event. Poured black with a nice tan head. Aroma is nutty, toasted malts, quite nice. Flavor is that same nutty note, some roast, bits of chocolate notes. Quite tasty.
500 ml bottle. Pours black with full tan head. Aromas of chocolate brownies, black coffee, roasted malts, and alcohol. Flavors of unsweetened dark chocolate, walnuts, roasted malts, and dry coffee.

Pours murky black with a modest head, Id prefer more of it on top though. Sweet barley on the nose (or perhaps thats rye), oiliness, hints of licorice. Flavour is strong meaty rye with a spicy twang on the back end, some burning from the alcohol. Dry finish. Meaty and heavy. Pretty good.

Brown - black color, no sun shines trough, with a moderate brown head, which vanishes fast. Caramel, toffee, malt, chocolate, amazingly enough floral hops are present. Smell points in a more bready direction.

Malt, bready, later on getting sweeter, toffee, but also bitter coffee, tobacco. Hops still play an important role, as they push the taste in a refreshing, bitter direction with suble floral notes. Very smooth mouthfeel, warming. Interesting beer, as it as both sweet and bitter components, melting together in a very balanced way, resulting in a complex body. Carbonation adds a metallic hint to the bitter, coffee aftertaste, throughout refreshing. Caramel and toffee in the beginning, then coffee and hops, which turn the beer bitter in an enjoyable way.

50cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Black colour, beige head. Aroma is sweet, chocolate, liquorice, molasses, pumpernickel. Flavour is sweet, malty, roasted malts, rye, chocolate, liquorice, light spicy, light bitter, bittersweet finish. Medium to full-bodied. Nice, but a bit too much on the sweet side, and lacks a bit of depth IMO.
Pours black with beige head. Aroma is roasted, smoke, licorice, pine and chocolate. Flavour is roasted, medium bitter, light sweet and pine. Awesome porter.
500 ml. bottle. Pours almost black with a decent tan head. Aroma of malt, grain, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, grain, chocolate, licorice, and coffee. Excellent.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with big foamy dark tan head, chocolate and dark fruit aroma, taste had dark fruits with big expresso coffee and hints of chocolate, trace of vanilla, glorious viscous mouthfeel, excellent.

What style is this?? Dark chocolate brown with a thick film floating on top. Aroma is smelless..... faint amounts of all things that have specific smells. It has a taste!! Ash, bitter chocolate, mighte be rye hard to tell. Taste good is all I know. A sweetness lingers in the background. Is that banana i detect?? Good brew.

Bottle. Dark viscous pour, minimal tan head that coats the sides of the glass leaving behind resinous legs. Aroma, coffee, strong roast, hops, very enticing and aromatic. Taste, sweet up front, a bit nutty, lots of roast and coffee like character, with a semi bitter aftertaste. Really enjoyed this!
On tap at La Fine Mousse, Paris. Pours black with brown head. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Full body. Roast malts, chocolate sweet flavor. Nice one.

Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of nice roasted dark malts, dark chocolate, caramel, roasted coffee, some notes of grassy hops in the background and some sweet liquorice. Quite textbook smelling! Taste of roasted coffee (some fruity espresso notes), roasted dark malts, toffee, some hoppy notes, liquorice and with a fairly smooth and suitable body. Carries alcohol very well. Textbook clean porter!

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbraunes Beir mit schöner beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Roggen, dunkle Früchte. Geschmack schokoladig röstmalzig, Roggenmalz, Kaffee, dunkle reife Früchte.

(bottle) pours a deep brown colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of herbal hops, caramel and cherries, slightly husky, with light notes of manure and earth. flavour is mostly toasted malts, alcohol and cherries, again slightly husky, with some light popcorn, caramel and a hint of barnyard. medium to heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

Aroma Is grains, chocolate, coffee, toast, yeast. Appearance: dark black pour, thick, tan head with lacing long after pour. Very nice looking. Taste is bitter chocolate, toast, coffee. Very smooth and tasty. A nice lagnaippe complement to my Fat Tuesday dinner.
Pours dark black with tan head. Creamy chocolate flavour with coffee finish. Body carries alcohol really well.

A nice well rounded brew overall with a dark completely opaque black body and tan head. The nose is rich and roasted with big boisterous coffee and rye toast notes. A bit sweet and dessert like with sweet chocolate and buent espresso flavours. Overall a warm finish with lingering roasted bitterness. A nice brew!

500ml bottle pours almost black in color with a finger of light brown head that has decent retention and leaves some spotty lacing. Aroma is licorice with hints of roasted grains and chocolate. Taste is a chocolate malty sweetness with a roasted grain and herbal bitterness finishing with lots of licorice and a light alcohol. Medium to heavy body with moderate carbonation. A very well done porter which is definitely worthy.

50 cL bottle at home. Pours dark brown to pitch black with a medium tanned head. Aroma has licorice, bread, rye, molasses and some alcohol. Taste is quite sweet with a lot of licorice, some molasses, dark chocolate, alchohol and some roasted malts, Medium to full bodied with a soft carbo giving it a velvety texture. A bit too much licorice for me, but nice stuff nonetheless.
Rund malziger Antrunk, intensiv mit leichter Süße und gänzlich ohne Alkoholnoten. Schokoladig, getreidig, zum Ende passend aber intensiv trocken. Mir zu dumpf, sonst gut! 11/12/11/11//11

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, nr Gent, Belgium. Consumed at hone Sunday 16th February 2014 Pours almost black on colour with a slim tan coloured head. Nice nose with some chocolate, roastiness and cocoa showing. Milk chocolate in mouth with some sticky chocolate fudge cake, quite indulgent. Its a bit creamy with some hoppy bitterness shing out from behind the chocolatey veil. A good beer.  A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6

Hells yea! This is megaballs deep. Smellz pretty good but his one is all about making my tongue turgid. Almost an impy stout. Creamu with the perfect amount of carbonation, soft and fat in the mouth is easier to take than hard and stiff. Some berry fruit that is not buried by the slightly bitter chocolate, solid roasted goodness, backend sweetness, brown sugar. Salivating lots. Super duper good! Faint anise and spots of ashtray. Just wonderful. Usually Im all about aroma but not this time. Not even bothering. This tastes excellent and worth the extra skrilla.
Lovely porter, full on mouthfeel with lots of spices and toasty flavours. Looks amazing in the glass, lots of body, chocolate, coffee and some fruit. Great porter!

A dark brown to black beer, with a nice light brown head. In the nose there is coffee, malt, fruit, cherry, alcohol and hoppy. It is a medium to full bodied beer, with a very nice corbanation. The taste is coffee, chocolate, fruity and some bitter and sweet from the hops. The aftertaste is long coffee and chocolate, with a bitter finish. A very nice porter, close to a stout, very nice!! Perhaps the best from Nogne o!
