coffee, woody, earthy, floral, brown foam, black, medium bitterness, full body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, 
This is my first attempt to rate a beer. Its a easy porter to drink and I love the strong bit,ter after taste along with the coffee sensation.
Pours a dark brown with a khaki head, smells very earthy (the rye) along with a nice dose of malt in the background. Taste of rye a long with some coffee along with maltyness, a lot of rye though.

Pored from bottle to shaker glass. A black with a decent tan head and a very fine lacing. Head thins down buy lasts to end. Aroma is complex but I can pick out an earthy combo of roasted malts and smoke. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, and a growing licorice in the finish. Warming and spicy. Carbonation is soft with a thicker velvety mouth feel. I loved the changing flavors and complexity of this beer. A winner in book.
Flaske fra vinmonopolet.slow gusher. Svart farge, litt oljeaktig, medium skumtopp.medium karbonert. Smaker alkohol, brunt sukker, bourbon,korn,røstet malt, lakris, gjær, sjokolade. Fantastisk god

0.5 L bottle at The Publican in Chicago, served in a stem glass. Pours black with a small tan head that fades to a thin remnant and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has big rye, roasted malts, smoke and a touch of earth. The flavour is medium-dry with roasted malts, coffee, spicy rye and piney hops that grow towards the finish, which is long and toasty with moderate hop bitterness. On the palate it is medium-full in body with a milky texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a very nice rye imperial porter with a generous dose of hops. 2013-12-30

Bouteille 50cl de Geers, BB 07/01/2017.
Brune foncée, col moka moyen doré au verre.
Arôme est malté caramel, chocolaté épais comme effluves. Pointe amer houblonnée avec une belle présence du seigle. En rétro-nasal, je note de belles pointes citronnées - agrumes.
Palais est épais avec ici aussi pas mal de malts; chocolat caramel, fini terreux et ce profil distinct de seigle. Épaisseur rappelant la mélasse, grillé et café avec un fini légèrement amer et houblonné. Palais est généreux avec un côté sirop.


Au final, une bière sympa mais qui manque de linfluence Terrapin surtout si on se base sur la Terrapin Rye Pale ale.

Color negro con reflejos rojizos y espuma beige densa y espesa. Los aromas son de cereales tostados, ligeramente dulces. En boa entra densa y sedosa con un dulzor seco que pasa a un amargor tostado, cafeteado e igualmente seco. Muy rica.

Bottle at Mr Hangovers Nieuwjaarsborrel, thanks to jmgreenuk. Dark, black pour with brown foam. Aroma is super roasty, very hoppy, nice hoppy aroma, licorice notes and molasses. Taste is bitter, light molasses sweetness, licorice, nice piney hop, light smokiness. Palate is med-full bodied, good carbonation. Tasty.

Bottle @ Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, courtesy of jmgreenuk. Pours a very dark brown beer with a small brown head on top. Aroma is grainy, rye and has some licorice. Flavor is very sweet with a big grainy base in it. The sweetness is backed up by a big bitter flavor in the back. Balance is very good in this beer, yet its missing a few components to be a great beer. Still quite good.

Bottle at Mr Hangovers 2014 Nieuwjaarsborrel, Den Haag and supplied by the Bier Koning, Amsterdam. Poured a deep mahogany with a round bubbly tan head. The aroma is light roasted malt and liqourice. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a rich smooth malt liqourice slightly alcoholic light hop palate. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. A super beer from Nogne. I would not expect anything less.
Bottle at Nieuwjaarsborrel. Pours dark brown. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, caramel and toffee. Very smooth. Moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Full body and quite thick. Long chocolate finish.
Bottle @ Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, hosted by MrHangover. Brown pour. Aroma is roasted malts, rye, licorice, molasses and burnt malts. Flavor is roasted, bitter and quite full bodied.
Bottle @ nieuwjaarsborrel. Aroma is roast, chocolate, molasses, etc. Flavour is roasty chocolate, roast, liquorice, molasses etc. Nice.

Bottle shared at Nieuwjaarsborrel thanks to Jmgreenuk. Pours near black with a small beige head. Aroma of caramel, rye, malt, overripe dark fruits. Flavor is over moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle sample at @nieuwjaarsborrel.
Thin tan head. Clear black pour. Lovely porter.

500 ml bottle shared. Pours dark brown to black in color with a medium sized creamy beige head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malt, dark chocolate, spicy rye notes, earthy hops, a splash of espresso with a dry, moderately bitter finish. Very nice collaboration and one I would have again.
Svært farve med beige skum. Lukt av malt, kaffe og sjokolade. Smak av malt, kaffe og sjokolade. Melkebaren.

500 ml bottle. Pours an orange tinted black with a short lived beige head. Aroma is chocolate, spice. Flavor is chocolate, coffee, spicy, some wood, tobacco. Finish is bitter coffee and chocolate, some menthol. Medium body, somewhat velvety mouthfeel and average carbonation.

50cl bottle, #761, brewed on 10.12.12. Pitch black, thin brown head. Aroma is overwhelming with licorice, wood, light smokey notes and rye quite strongly later on. Very smooth, oily mouthfeel. Flavor has chocolate, coffee, rye, licorice, hops. Espresso-like strong coffee in the dry, bitter finish. At the same time it feels velvety smoothin the mouth. Full bodied superb beer.- beerbasher/winphone

Bottled. Sample 0,1ltr. The aroma has coffee, rye, some raisin tones, slight fruity hops. Dark coloured with a beige head. The taste is sweetish, and becomes more bitter towards the finish. The rye kicks in in the middle. Mouthfeel is smooth, bit slick with a medium-full body. Some kind of ashy/balsamic/aceton off-flavour (Couldnt really pinpoint it) makes this beer a bit unbalanced. Good thing is that it is quite well drinkeable for its abv.
Sort med lys brunt skum. Mørk sjokolade, salt lakris, moden stenfrukt- plomme til sviskelukt. Søt, fyldig litt salt smak. Lite kullsyre, behagelig fyldig medium lang ettersmak.
Svart farge med beige skum. Aroma av plomme, røk og kaffe kommer fram her. Fyldig og smaker godt sødme, malt. Lang ettersmak. Meget god:-)
poured a dark brown black colour with a 2 finger beige head. roasted chocolate, caramel malts, rye, dark fruits, vanilla, smooth and creamy mouthfeel. great beer

Bottle at home (bottled 07/01/13, batch 906). Pours black with a medium sized tan head. Aroma of alcohol, roasted malts, and chocolate. Chocolate and roasted malts taste, not so much alcohol as expected from the smell. Some hops in the aftertaste. Could be bit more creamy. Nice beer.

pours unclear dark brown, red tint, with a small light beige head, some retention and lacing. dense chocolate, tobacco, nice fruitiness - cherries, spices, pepper, some burnt caramel, booze, leather, some smokiness. moderate carbonation, light to medium body - oily, almost silky, balanced grassy-peppery-spicy finish. complex and pretty enjoyable and solid strong porter - a pleasant surprise..

500ml bottle. Pitch black colour with late awakening, huge, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, brown head. Initially chocolately dark malty aroma with hints of roast and a touch of biscuit as well as cautious floral hoppy overtones, developes - while warming up - notes of leather and tannic acid, tarmac, peat, shoe polish, liquorice. Taste is dry dark malty, bitter hoppy, herbal overtones, hints of roast, heavily salty liquorice and the like; minimally burning alcohol in the finish. Not exclusively endowed with flattering flavours, but rich, complex, heavy, full-bodied. A well-deserved week-ending.
Draft - pours dark brown with tan head. Nose is coffee and brown sugar. Sip adds roast, dark fruit and something on the tip of my tongue but I cant... Complex bitterness. Long roast finish.

Sort farge i glasset med lavt skum. Søtlig aroma av malt og mild sjokolade. Smaken er litt bitter, malt, og antydning til tørket frukt i form av rosiner kanskje. Også sjokolade og kaffe. God i munnen, med fin bitterhet i ettersmaken. Middels tykk konsistens. Ganske god egentlig, men for min del kunne den gjerne hatt enda mer sjokolade/kaffe i smaken.

500ml bottle, deep black color, with a thick tan bubbly head, with a chocolate cake, chocolate pudding, dark bitter chocolate, chocolate syrup nose, with some faint chocolate chip cookie dough, café latte, roasted, chocolate, black, toasted malt notes, and some burnt dark dried fruit, burnt date squares, black coffee, light molasses accents in the aroma follows through on a full-bodied palate with a warmth, yeasty, mint chocolate, chocolate cake, fudgy, chocolate praline, brownie, molasses, black coffee, burnt bran muffin character, with a good roasted, chocolate, black, toasted caramel, spicy rye malty cereal, chocolate pudding flavour, and a burnt toast, flowery leafy, grassy, piney hoppy undertone, leading towards a warming, smooth bitter chocolate, burnt fruitcake, molasses, fudgy, chocolate syrup, coffeeish, lingering roasty bitterness finish.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of licorice, chocolate, light coffee, bread, light pepper and dried fruit. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with notes of licorice, chocolate, light coffee and bread. Medium to full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Really nice.

Pours clear, very dark reddish brown, almost black. Forms a very nice, light brown head that sits for quite some time and leaves a nice lacing on the sides of the snifter. Aromas on the nose are dominated by spices, pepper and a dry, dusty smokiness and woody aromas too. The alcohol content is amazingly not that noticeable on the aromas. Aromas on the tongue are quite similar to those already mentioned, but with a nice dark tinge to it. The taste is semi-sweet, with a nice somewhat dry finish, and a lingering aftertaste. The mouthfeel is surprisingly thin for a hefty and complex porter like this, but in a good way. This beer is excellent; one of the best Ive had.

Got this on a trip to Ghent in Belgium. Bottle had been aged in store for a year. Had it when it came out last year and was excited to get another bottle. Sad I couldnt bring ,ore back with me. Aroma of alcohol, coffee, chocolate, dark bread. Pours thick. Opaque black-brown. Super luscious mouth feel - thick and creamy. Taste of dark chocolate up front, bitterness comes in slowly changing it to a rye bread and then coffee flavour. Bitterness has slight hop character remaining that is noticeable in the finish. There is a warming boozy quality but it does not detract. Wonderfully balanced and delicious beer.

9% bottle from Rakuten, roughly 1000 yen. A dark reddish black pour with a good finger of a tan head. A strong boozy, malty chocolate aroma wafts from the glass. The taste is full bodied, smooth, rich chocolate, some roastiness, a fair amount of booze & a kind of tangy quality reminiscent of a port or other slow drinking aperitif. Nice stuff though I am not getting the kind of spiciness I usually associate with rye...  A touch of smoke after warming, very pleasant.

My Bottom Line :  
Black pepper-laden caramel and roasted malts move into molasses and resinous hops in this rich and flavorful dessert brew.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A sheet of foam covers the brown-edged blackness.
-The long malty finish is endearing.
-Some chocolate peers through here and there.
-This ones begging for a peppery steak.

Bottle.

Nøgne Ø / Terrapin Imperial Rye Porter. 9% duft:vanilje,mørk sirup,ristet malt, rosin, soja, Smag: stor sødme, rund og fyldig smag af malt, kakao, vanilje, en fin kant af ristet mørk malt, en fin varm smag af alkohol,
Bottle. This is a killer porter with the nice dry dustiness of rye on the side.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2014 Bottle from Sola VP. Dark color with brown head. Coffee and some roasted flavor, Chocloate. Taste of roasted coffee and roasted malts. Som aalcohol there, A nice tasting strong porter.
Bottled. Many thanks to Cuso. Dark color, nice aroma, plum and chocolate, coffee, raisins, liquorice. Full chewy body. Great delicious beer after hard day.

Bottle from pivoteka Beergeek, Prague. Dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, prunes, dark berries. Taste, dark chocolate, espresso, vanilla, licorice, cocoa nibs, alcohol. Strong alcoholic finish. Tasty.

Bottle shared by Cuso. Aroma chocolate, coffee, dark fruits. Strong, sweet, woody. Near black colour. Taste is nicely balanced, strong dark chocolate, coffee. Raisins, liquorice. Full chewy body. Very enjoyable. My only objection is a light sourness in the taste, but it is not too strong.
Bottled by Cuso. Many thanks! Amazing dark chocolate and coffee aroma! Medium bodied but chocolate bitter tasty! A nice warming alcohol aftertaste. Not easy to drink, but a delicacy.
Bottle, courtesy of Cuso. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, plums, hints of alcohol. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, cocoa, plums, alcohol. Medium bittersweet finish
Very special beer. Really easy to drink and very little flavor. A little less fragrance but a great beer to drink. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Pours black, creamy off-white lasting head. Roasted rasin, figs and coffee aroma.. Enjoyable! Coffe, liquorice, sweet chocolate taste. Awsome mouthfeel. Roasty, malty finish. Great beer.
Belmont bottle of unknown age since I found it hiding in a box. This is a really great, strong porter with tons of coffee and chocolate that finishes with a spicy rye bite. Well done.

0,5 l bottle rated at home. Pours a clear near black mahogany body covered by a small dense brown head that leaves beautiful laces on the glass. Inviting coffee, raisin and dark chokolate on the nose, quite boozy too bringing thoughts of cognac to mind. Coffee and sweet liquorice explodes and rides the full bodied and alco warm mouth feel right through to the end that lasts and lasts. Lovely roasted notes and a pleasant bitterness. Well balanced and smooth to drink. Rich and complex. A true delight.
0,5l bottle from Flagship Alko. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, rye, coffee and chocolate. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, rye and hops. Quite nice.

Bottle: Poured a deep black color porter with a rather large brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of roasted malt with light spicy rye notes and some residual sugar notes. Taste is mxi between light dry roasted malt notes with spicy notes of rye also noticeable and some well-balanced residual sugar. Body has a really nice creamy texture with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Solid porter with rye notes adding further complexity.

500ml bottle from IPB.
Appearance : Pitch black with tiny head.

Aroma : Coffee and spicy rye with light acidic notes. Red dry fruits. Slightly sweet rye notes.

Taste : Cold coffee with spicy rye. Light tar. Finish is slightly resinous with moderate bitterness.

Palate : Really soft carbonation. Nearly flat.

Overall : Nice rye profile. Nice coffee notes as well. Fairly well made but could use a bit more carbonation... I think it would help with the aroma. Well done, packed with flavor, not too heavy and fairly well balanced.

0.5 L bottle from Bieropholie, served cool in a tulip glass, 22/03.16. Deep brown black with a decent mocha head. Lots of deep molasses and licorice, lightly peppery some grape jelly spicy, heavy, rich, a little alcohol, inky and very big. Medium-full body, relaxed effervescence, very creamy. Tons of big, black, inky molars, licorice, huge stuff, lightly peppery with decent leafy hops, so big and malty; sweet with pretty good bitterness and a long, very deep, dark finish. Wow, this is work!

Thick black pour with a creamy light tan head. Chocolate, rye notes, 
Smooth sweet body.

Pours a viscous dark brown with deep rugby highlights. Dense chestnut brown head. Nose is pretty nice, burnt sugar and charred grain with some dark fruit. Kind if acrid with some chocolate. Very ashy and pacific dark grain dominant flavor. Very sharp and charred. Medium full body. Bleh

50 cl. courtesy of Man-ki. Thx! Shared by 3. Bottled on 10.02.2012. Pours black with basically no head. Smells of rye bread, spices, chocolate, rum pie, touch coffee, some pleasant alcohol presence and deeply toasted wood. Taste of rye bread, spices, molasses, light warming / boozy nature, thick, some bitterness in the back, bitter roast, Little carb. very thick cold coffee feel. Very nice. These guys continue being very solid to say the least.

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Légère odeur de café avec une pointe de sauce soya. Apparence: La couleur est noire avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de café torréfié et de chocolat avec une pointe fruitée. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de chocolat amer en arrière goût. (Rating #5008)

Bomber brought back from Athens, GA. Fumes, dark chocolate, and grainy malt in the nose. Pitch black with dark tan edges. Winey, chocolately, cocoa, intiial / light prunes / thick powdery dusting of cocoa in the finish. Medium-heavy body, smooth and slick. Farily exceptional, as a porter. Somehow light, even with the high alc. and flavors levels.

10 oz pour. At Tylers Apex. good aroma. Soysauce. Chocolate. Dark orangy blackish brown color. Good head that faded to a ring. Minor lace. Bittersweet flavor. Thick body, oily creamy mouthfeel, bittersweet finish good, yet not one Im getting excited about. Has too much of that soysauce.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

Dark brown color, steady creamy brown head. There is rye in the aroma, some toasted notes and light sweet chocolate. Medium-bodied and soft palate. Cocoa, milkyness, some rye and light alcoholic bitterness in the aftertaste. Pleasant.

A totally black beer with a beautiful, brown and weak head. The nose is very intensive, lots of salt liquirice, some smoke, liquirice, balanced sweetness, also some fresh fruits. Taste is rich, roasted, coffee, salt liquirice, still fresh, some fruits, balanced bitterness. Full bodied, low carbonation, smooth and pleasant to drink. A very typical Nøgnes flavours, the strong and intensive,

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2015 Bottled. Nose of chocolate, light coffee, grains, pear. Black with lace. Thin, light body with cocoa and coffee, dark fruits. A bit too thin, though works in the summer. Dry finish with roast and some hops.
Bottle. Black colour with brown head. Roasted and rye aroma. Roasted and rye taste, sweet. Medium to full body.

Bottle @ home, picked up at Wilburs Fort Collins. Pours a deep brown appearance with a dark brown head. Tons of spicy rye, chocolate, burnt/charred, light smoke aroma. Anise, dark chocolate, roasty malty, lightly charred, big cocoa, somewhat spicy, vanilla, light coconut flavor. Goddamn, thats fucken tasty.
bottle. pours black with perfect creamy tan head. burnt oat aroma. taste is very burnt wheat rye and nuts, lots of bitter hop

Dark body and a tan head. Nice aroma with malts and caramel. Tastes very good, has some roasted malts to it. The taste is very rich and full and it lingers in your mouth for a while. On the palate its very nice also, very soft feeling.
Overall, this is a great beer and I would recommend it to everyone.

Bottle. Black color, wispy but lasting tan head. Oaky hop aroma with a hint of vanilla. Superbly smooth flavor with chocolate fudge and coffee. Full body, medium carbonation. A dessert unto itself, truly wonderful.

Tap Sail and Anchor, Fremantle
delciuos spicyness and hoppiness, in sweet dark matls, very nice

From keg at Grünerløkka Brygghus, Oslo, Norway; Pours very dark with next to no head. Aromas include coffee and dark fruits. Taste palate includes tones of prunes, coffee, brown sugar and faint hint of liquorice. A complex yet balanced porter. Recommended.
Draft at Farmers Cabinet. Black pour with a slight tan head. Syrupy smoked raisins. Shoe polish. Shoo Fly Pie. Burnt cherry cordial. Turkish coffee. Burnt toast. Sweet black raisins.
Aroma of smoke, raisins and licorice. Dark, dark brown with tiny white head. Bitter and sweet, and some smoke. Quite thin, but long lasting taste of smoke.

Black color with big beige head. Aroma of chocolate, milk, nuts, roasted malts. Taste is light sweet, light to medium bitter, chocolate flavor. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Really nice

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours reddy black with a creamy tan lacing. Espresso, chocolate and rye aroma. Smells awesome. Taste is similar, nice sweetness with a subtle rye after taste. Sweet, bitterness and lingering after taste. Fuck yeah.

Sample on tap at the Porter Beer Bar. Pours pitch black, with a medium, tan head. Nice milk chocolate aroma, with some toastiness and spicy rye through the finish. Very sweet and smooth flavor, with none of the normal stout/porter burnt flavor. Nice spiciness through the finish. Medium to heavy body, smooth and creamy. Very nice porter.

Black as night, very modest head. Rather sweet caramel taste, coffee and chocolate, but rather reasonable bitterness in aftertaste. Very nice and versatile, plenty of the same character that all Nøgne Ø beer possess.

On tap at the Farmers Cabinet for beer week.  Aroma is amazing.  I described it as Wookie Jack without the hops.  Great stinging rye with a good chocolate roasty back.  Pours black with a very small white head.  The taste is unbelievable.  Rye, chocolate, licorice, caroway, coffee, and pepper.  I would love to share this beer with everyone.

A - Dark brown-black with a finger of frothy chocolate colored head. Fades normal.

S - Roasted chocolate and dark caramel malts, spicy rye, black licorice, molasses, coffee, hint of dark fruit, a bit of booze.

T - Roasted dark chocolate and dark caramel malts, spicy rye, molasses, roasted coffee, black licorice, bit of dark fruits, vanilla, and some booze.

M - Full bodied, moderate carbonation. Smooth and a touch creamy with a sweet, roasted, warming finish.

D - Nice imperial porter. Good overall balance.
500 ml bottle. Pours a near black with a khaki colored head of foam. Aroma is spicy and roasty. Tastes near smoky with a hint of spice kick at the end. Interesting beer. It worked really well.

Bottle at CGarvie tasting. It pours very dark with a small beige head. The nose is light roasted malt, dark fruit, berry and earth. The taste is rather fruity as well, dried fruit, berry, bitter-sweet aspect, light roast, spice, brown bread, cocoa and some alcohol warmth. Medium+ body and moderate carbonation. Good balance and flavour. Rather drinkable.
a bit thin but nice & roasty & alive long intense lingering  shimmering licenses. Very good.  nice colab. like the rye quality. what it should be

UPDATED: APR 29, 2013 bottle at home ... deep black ... thin lacing .. soft toffee fruits ... soft chocolate roast ... mellowsmooth roast ... light rye ... mellow chocolate roast ... soft dark malt roast ... nice and easy ..3.6.  remain of the bottle ... deep black ... big tan head ... dark roast ... light smoke nose  ... mellow rich roast ... big chocolate ... light rye ... mellow deep and rich ...

You can really taste and smell that smoked rye. Hops and yeast are awesome. Has a slight Belgium character in the finish. Cracked rye. Chocolate, toasty, bitter and sharp. Very little sweetness if at all. Must try.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2013 From a 500ml bottle on 7/4/2013. Pours close to black with a very small head. The aroma features light caramel, golden syrup and a touch of soy. Taste wise theres lots of dark chocolate, some caramel, licorice, alcohol and a strong roasty bitterness.You do get a touch of rye right at the end. The body is medium and the carbonation relatively low. Not special, but rather enjoyable none the less.

500. Pours black with a dense and creamy tan head. Lots of sheeting lace. Big rich roasty rye peppery nose, great balance of sweet and savory from the grains with not a lot of hop contribution. Thick slushy body you could probably float a quarter on. Dense roasty mid palate, dark chocolate, coffee, rich peppery rye spice. Very nicely integrated and a pleasure to drink...long roasty finish.

Brown bottle,  0,5 1, best before 22/03.16, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on April 17 2013; eye: black, opaque, nice dark brown head, nice lacing; nose: roasted barley, dark coffee, dark chocolate, hops, spices; mouth: roasted barley, dark coffee, dark chocolate, hops, astringency, spices, acidity, dry finale in roasted barley with presence of pleasant acridness, medium-full body, good carbonation, mildly bitter, creamy and lightly harsh texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune,  0,5 1, meilleure avant22/03.16, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 17 avril 2013; il : noire, opaque, belle mousse brun foncé, bonne dentelle; nez : orge torréfiée, café noir, chocolat noir, houblon, épices; bouche : orge torréfiée, café noir, chocolat noir, houblon, astringence, épices, acidité, finale sèche en orge torréfiée avec présence dâcreté plaisante, corps moyen-corsé, bonne carbonatation, moyennement amère, texture crémeuse et légèrement rugueuse; en résumé : bien bon
UPDATED: APR 18, 2013 En botella.Fantastica colaboración tiene  lo mejor de cada casa.entrada suave con complejidad de sabor.Rye forever!
On tap at Crowbar, Oslo. Almost black with a creamy beige head. Dark fruit and espresso nose. Tart berries mingle with roast coffee beans. Good mouthfeel. Special.

Pours thick like syrup, black with a small tan head. The nose is heavy wood, rye spiciness, chocolate and booze.  It's decadent. The taste is soft and creamy, the body is heavy and finish is huge!  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black, medium tan head. Smells roasty, rye, dark choc, hops, toffee.. Tastes .. Dark fruits, dark rich choc, strong malts, roasty and pretty bitter coffee finish when warmer. Real nice
Aroma is dark malts, vinous/dark fruit and a liquor/bourbon quality.  The flavor is dark malts, vinous notes, mild/medium spiciness from the rye and a mix of tartness and acidity in the finish.

Bottle. Pours a near black color with a smallish light brown head. I get some of the grains in the nose, but some roasting and chocolate really is forward in the nose. Taste is quite similar, with a hint of sweetness up front but a tad bit of bitterness on the back end. Really smooth and easy drink. I like it muchly.

Completely opaque with a dark, thin head. Rather inviting aroma of rye, chocolate, and dark fruit. Extremely smooth and complex. Layer upon layer of flavor. Rye and chocolate first, then figs, currants, charred wood, and burnt marshmallows. There is a hint of sweetness followed by a lasting chalky finish. Deceptive 9% ABV.

This is outstanding. Get it.

Black body, brown head. Aroma  is very rich and complex, some roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and dark caramel with medicinal and herbal hoppiness. Palate is full and really ovewhelming. Bitterness is high but its balanced well with malty sweetness. Extremely nice beer.

Botella. Black coloured with a nice big dense brown creamish head, good lacing. Well roasted maltiness in the aroma along with bready rye and chocolate to it., herbalish to. Good filling mouthfeel. Well roasted maltiness, bready rye, chocolate flavour, some herbal spice to it too underneath all the first mentioned thing.

Great beer with chochlate, fruity, tasteful and a beauty of a beer..........

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Deep brown pour with dense tan coloured head. Chocolate dominates the nose with some alcohol and roasted grain. Flavours are amazing. Silky smooth with heaps of cocoa sweetness and just enough roasted grain on the finish to balance. Slick full mouthfeel. Brilliant stuff. Really enjoyed this one.

Une bouteille de 50 cl.  Meilleure avant le 22/03/2016.  Une bière complètement dominée par les ténèbres.  Une coiffe diaboliquement brune et très solide.  Un nez percé par des malts qui portent, outre la richesse dun caramel très foncé et cette douce sensation épicée, une fumée latente avec des noix concassées, une réglisse fruitée et des houblons qui murmurent des choses vertes et peut-être aussi jaunes.  Sur les papilles, la concoction expose toute sa gentillesse avec ses saveurs de grains rôtis, caramélisés et chocolatés.  Une apparition houblonnée vient secouer toute cette contribution maltée.  En bouche, le liquide présente un corps de moyenne densité avec un pétillement doux et une texture crémeuse.  En finale, des malts qui se resserent et qui perdent une fumée dans cette avancée houblonnée et amère.  Encore une réussite signée Nogne O.

0,5L bottle.  Black pour, thin dark brown foam.  Aroma of licorice, charred malts, Irish Coffee, dark chocolate, unsweetened cocoa.  Heavy boozy nose. Very heavy bodied, oily texture.  Smooth mouthfeel, creamy, soft dryness.  Tastes of chocolate, some sweet (not salty) soy sauce, roast, light char, a little rye spice, ash.  Goes down like a slow made toffee with cream.  Very soft.  Perfect balance, so residual\cloying sweetness.  ABV is hidden, although it is throughout the aroma.  Finishes with a nutty licorice character with some pine hops in the end.  Damn, how do these guys do it??

(3631)

Bouteille de 50cl meilleure avant le 22/03/16. Bière brune presque noire avec une mousse brune crémeuse. Le liquide est épais. Superbe nez de malt chocolat, de noix et de levure fruité. La bouche a une belle texture huileuse, ferme avec une bonne amertume. Agréable, longue, superbe. Jaurais envie décrire des lignes et des lignes mais la bière mappelle.  Un autre grand classique de Nogne.

A smallish off-white head covers the dark brown, not quite black pour. Slick looking, oily, spicy, earthy aroma with moderate spicy, resinous hop notes and plenty of dark malts intricacies, including grenoble nut powder, woodsy smoke and dark chocolate amidst other. Deep yet not overly invasive alcohol brings as much sweetness as the malts themselves. It makes for a dry ensemble and a fairly original one, the rye certainly providing a nice touch in that regard and turning the focus away from what could have been astringency; those dark malts are taking a lot of room, but maintain an oiliness and a smoke focus that fit together nicely. Not extremely complex, but posting plenty of different flavors in a round and seducive fashion we are not used to seeing together and hence flavorful and captivating. Very nice recipe and indeed a sound concept to bring Terrapin and Nogne O in the same brew room.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: lots of foam, stays.
Nose: coffee, chocolate.
Taste: chocolate, coffee, blueberry, gin
Very nice beer!
thx Joris for sharing

(50 cl bottle from Den Nordiske Ølhandel; Batch 808/818B; BBD: June 6th 2016; Brewed on June 5th 2012) Pours black with thick, creamy tan head. Good retention and beautiful lacework. Aroma is subtly bready with toffee and rye notes and a hint of alcohol and herbal hops. Creamy texture, soft carbonation, full body and a roasted, warming finish. Taste generally follows the nose. Rustic but quite well balanced and pleasant. A much better experience than years ago when I ended up paying upwards of 20 USD for a bottle of Nøgne Ø beer at Aker Brygge that turned out to gush a third of its contents on the table in front of me.
Pours dark brown to black with beige head. Smells of vanilla and  chocolate with some coffee notes. Good stuff, but if possible, I would go for the regular Imperial Stout from Nøgne Ø.
UPDATED: APR 20, 2013 Pours almost black with a medium beige head. Very good taste of roasted malt, rye, licorice and coffee, but not too intense. Long good aftertaste. Body is above medium.
Black, small tan head. Subtle roast, dark malts, mild burnt rubber. Very smooth! Sweet mild roastedness. Tasty! Slight bitterness.But nice sweetness. Great porter. Not too roast. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Bottle from Alko. Black color, brown head. Strong, roasty taste with coffee, liquorice, nuts, roasted malts and rye. Nicely balanced body. Roasty finish with burnt coffee and nuts. Exquisite imperial porter.

Nice rich color and head. Decent taste with coffee undertones in the aftertaste.

Bottle. Very dark brown color with a medium-sized tan head. Roasted malt, licorice, dark fruits and coffee in the aroma. Flavor is roasted malt, licorice, coffee, some rye and dark fruits. Medium to full body, quite smooth mouthfeel. Dry and bitter finish. Very tasty porter.

Rich tan head dark pour medium carbonation aromas coffee dark chocolate liquorice cocoa caramel soy the rye sweetness and sharpness the flavours rye very forward lovely touch dark chocolate medium bitter well balanced ale liquorice caramel mocha like coffeee brown sugar finish sharp tasting rich porter great aftertastes of the rye rich malts lasting bitter top stuff

On tap at Frisco Taphouse ($13/10oz): pours an opaque oily black with a creamy froth of beige head. Has a rich, sweet dark caramel malty nose with a touch of toasted rye and dark chocolate. Courtesy of and shared with Nordcore:

500 ml bottle.  Served in a snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with about a half inch tan head.  Head retention and lacing are both good. 500ml bottle (ALEhouse, Riga)
Rich rye aroma, loevly full body. Sticky rye-bread everywhere. Yummy body, just so scrumptious. I love the rich rye that permeates the body. Fuck, fuck, fuck, this is a great beer.

500ml bottle (as a Bday present from FatPhil & Anna, thanks). Deep brown, almost black color.  Tiny brown head surrounds the glass. Malty, roast, licorice, hops, grassy, floral aroma. Deep deep roast, malty, grainy, slightly sweet, grassy hops in flavor. Alcohol in aftertaste. But still wonderful beer. Thank you!

500 ml bottle. Black, with a tiny beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, liquorice, dark chocolate and rye bread. The flavour is roasted malty, dryish, slightly acidic, with chocolate, coffee and rye. Nicely roasted finish. Very tasty.

Talking about porters, this is almost like a stout. So smooth palate and taste, almost creamy. But aroma and taste itself is very textbook like, although almost too smooth to be a porter. Still, there are those roasted flavors. Licorice, malts. Wide taste spectrum and sufficiently masked taste of alcohol. Sufficient carbonation. Despite of a lack of some edge (as a porter), this surely is the best of its kind this far.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 No head and all almost. Coffee and some roasted flavor, a little tiny bit of sourness. Smooth as silk very easy to drink for the strength and bigness. Good. Serving:Bottle
Black with small tan head. Chocolate, rye bread, coffee in aroma. Full, oily mouthfeel with hardness from rye. Bitter coffeelike taste with lot of dark chocolate. Lingers long and well. Excellent.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. Pours black with a small but thick head that leaves a brown layer on top. Flavours of espresso, chocolate, rye bread; in the finish resin and pine. Velvety, creamy texture and a nice, full body; soft carbonation. Classy beer, very well balanced. Intense but not harsh. Maltier but not quite as hoppy as Nognes Imperial Stout. Brilliant.

Almost black, brown head, lacing.

Present from GT2. Pour is black with large tan head with good retention and lacing. Aroma is baking chocolate, fresh roasted coffee and Biscoff cookies. Yum! Taste is similar with the acidic coffee balanced out by a creamy softness. Silky mouthfeel and very balanced palate. Not too bitter, and definitely not to sweet. Quite dry. The rye really rounded this out quite nicely.

500mL from Bine&Vine. Pours clear, deep ruby. Massive, dense, mocha foam. Huge retention and complete webby lacing. Nose is Khalua, Baileys, waxy dark chocolate. Moves to cured black olive and animal. Taste is very dry, coffee acid, lemon, waxy dark chocolate. Dry, acidic coffee finish. Palate feels silky but still very dry and roasty. This is a great balance, no residual sugar, no off flavors. Very dense, melted chocolate bar palate. I guess one of those that is greater than the sum of its parts. Fiancé rating: 4.2

Bottle. BBE 10/02/2017. Pours black with a small ring of dark mocha-colored bubbles. Aroma is quite roasy: Sweet roasted rye malt. Like smelling a fresh loaf of malt rye bread or a batch of rye bread dough ready for baking. A light touch of ethanol is detectable as well if you look for it. Taste is somewhat sweet, lots of rye in the beginning with a lot of roast as well. Quite a bit of coffee on the finish with a touch of chocolate. Rye stays throughout. Dries up on the finish with a light touch of wooden hops. Chocolate and rye on the aftertaste. Palate is full and oily.

16.9 oz bottle.  Dark brown with a big bubbled tan head; sheets of lace.  Nose is chocolate, rye, dates and molasses.  Medium to full body with a tang.  Taste is coffee and milk chocolate, getting bitter with licorice, fading into a dry rye finish.  Simple but well conceived and executed.

Bottle. Pours black with tan brown head. Nose and taste of rye, roasted chocolate malt, roasted coffee, vanilla and milk chocolate. Finishes quite dry with a rye/chocolate finish. Nice roast up front. Body is on the thinner side of medium for an imperial porter.

Bottle from mane liquor. First beer of 2013! Jet black thick oily pour with a small tanned head. Nose showcases heavy notes of espresso with hints of milk chocolate and maybe vanilla. Aroma of licorice rye chocolate malts. Black, brow very thin head. Smooth taste, alcohol burns a bit but doesnt taste. Very long roasted aftertaste. Excellent imperial stout
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2012 Bottle 50 cl. Black with a lightbrown head. Aroma of dark fruit and chocolate. Sweet taste with a choco end.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Norway. Pours deep black, with a thick and dark beige head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts, but very interestingly quite hoppy and fruity as well. Solid complex beer.

It has this long and balanced bitterness and coffee roastiness. This is a very pleasant beer. The smooth texture caresses your mouth. It feels lika a gentle hug on your tongue. A masterpiece.

Bottle b761. Black, thickish, nonexistent head. Big chocolate roasted malt aroma. Feels soft, vanilla. A bit of licorice, molasses. Very normal imperial stout like. Body is full, soft, thick. Long. Im not sure what the rye contributed to the flavour palette, but I guess its possible to sense some ryeness when you know about it. Otherwise a very nice black drink. Reminds me of Divides products.
Black and creamy. Sweet and mellow. The vanilla feel is wild! Great beer

Bottled. Pours deep brown with a large , beige head, that leaves a good lacing on the glass. Nose of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel and licorice. Sweet flavor with a more dry and  bitter.  Full bodied, creamy texture and soft CO2. An excellent brew. ★★★★
Bottle. Black with a thick creamy light brown head. Nice burnt caramel, toast, chocolate, rye bread, and roasted grain aroma and taste with a creamy palate and a dark chocolate and citrus finish.

Taste: Roasted malts, plenty of bitter dark chocolate with a little pinch of licorice and some of the zestful rye coming across mingled with some underlying hop bitterness from the woodsy hops and alcohol warmth. Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium carbonation. Fairly creamy, soft mouthfeel.

Overall: Fairly solid while not a jump for joy beer. Nøgne Ø generally handles the malty brews well.

Very dry and bitter with a dank, earthy pine needle presence that lingers over the spicy rye and roasted malts into a bone dry finish. In desperate need of some sweetness to combat the acrid, burnt malt profile and overpowering hop bitterness. As it warms and the palate adjusts, the rye character and subtle malt sweetness comes toward the forefront. Hints of burnt dark chocolate malt, oatmeal, robust coffee bean and caramel before finishing with subtle boozy heat. Not bad, but too hoppy for the style in my opinion and could use some more sweetness for balance.

Bottle at Tilt. Black body with a low dark brown head. Yummy! Low carbonation, thick body. Sweet caramel aroma with roasted malt, some smoke. Taste of caramel, rye, roast, dark chocolate. Dry bitter finish.
Black pour, chocolate brown head. Raisins, chocolate, molasses, roast, rye, and coffee aroma. Flavor is bold, lots of rye, chocolate, roast, prunes, and a bitter finish. Really great.

Smells roasty, dark chocolate and some alcohol. Great apperance, dark as midnight on a moonless night with a tan head. The taste is sharp from the rye, but with a smooth mouthfeel. Well balanced, alcohol is hidden well, but gives away some warmth. A very good beer from NØ and Terrapin, exciting and well done!

Henrik Ol & Vinstove, Bergen tap: Pour is black with a brown head. Aroma is rye and very roasted malt, perhaps a bit burnt. Also, there is some dark chocolate. Taste is slightly sweet. It is not as bitter as was expected. Lots of roast. Finish is pretty dope. This is a well-balanced, well-covered beer. I love it when beers try new things and pull them off sexily on the first try.
This is an excellent beer. Thick and a bit smoky, it has a chewy dark chocolate flavor to it. A little milky flavors to it. Pretty good.

Sample at Ale Wine & Spirits in Powell on 08/09/2012. Brownish-black pour with a medium tan head that diminishes slowly. Small patches of lace on the glass. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and hops. Medium to full body with a roasty malt character and notes of hops, coffee and anise. The finish is mildly bitter coffee and licorice. Above average Porter overall.

Comes out of the bottle a deep, warm sable with a very thick tan head that sticks around for a bit and leaves some generous lacing. The sample I got fizzed quite a bit, but at least I didnt get a miniature Old Faithful the way I have on occasion. Rich, smoky aroma has notes of molasses, quality coffee, semi-sweet chocolate, caramel and toffee. Lip-smacking flavor fills the mouth with roast malt, quality coffee, caramel, wood, licorice and hops plus a noticeable alcohol nip. Smooth, firm-bodied texture has good fizz and leaves a slightly sweet, slightly hop bitter, smoky and tingly finish. The offspring of Terrapin and Nogne-O is a beautiful child!

Bottle 50cl, a dark beer with low brown head. Nose is sweet like, on caramel, roasted malt and roasted barley, burnt caramel and licorice. Aroma is on roasted malt with dark chocolate notes, very creamy, dark coffee, licorice, dried gapes, peppery and metallic hops. Long roasted notes at the finish, very near the usual imperial stout.

On tap. Pours black with a thick creamy brown head that lasts throughout the beer and laces nicely. Aroma has a good amount of roasted malt with a hint of of creamy bitter chocolate and underlying rye. Flavor begins with a note of creamy chocolate that is backed by roasted malts and a growing rye note underlying.

50cl bottle thanks to Joes. Pitch black, opaque color, no head. Smell dark and roasted malts, moccha, dark chocolate. Taste dark and roasted malts, moccha, actually would say oatmeal instead of rye. Thick texture, medium to full body, medium carbo.

Bottle thx to joes. Pitch black, opaque colour with a quickly gone light brown head. Smells coffee, roasty, dark chocolate. Mostly coffee and mocca. Tastes coffee, mocca, dark chocolate. Very silky, smooth, velvet and thick feel. Low carbo, full body.

500mL bottle, pours a very dark brown / black with a medium tan head. Aroma of cocoa powder, oats, rye and light roasted - the rye and cocoa are most prominent. Flavour brings out the rye above anything, with secondary notes of bakers chocolate, some coffee and medium roasted malt. Full-bodied, very soft palate, with very harsh rye on the finish. Could be confused for a harsh black IPA, though the rye is in place of the hops. Quite solid, though harsh.

Draught at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Finland.
Black colour with small dark tan head.
Roasted malt, sugary sweetness, ashy dryness and alcohol in aroma.
Flavour is sweet alcohol, roasted malt, bitter hops, potato starch and mild ashy dryness. 
Thick and rich palate. Good one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Draught at Pikkulintu, 20120804) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had roasted malts, liquorice and rye bread. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were roasted malts, hops, rye bread, molasses and bitterness. Aftertaste was malty and bitter. Nice, balanced and alcohol was well hidden.
Tap @ CBC.Dark brown body with a small offwhite head. Aroma is roasted malt, bread, brown sugar, spice, rye. Flavor is light hops, roasted malt, rye, syrup.

500ml bottle. Black color. Thin brown head. Fades to minimal. Some dots of lace. Some sediment at the bottom of the glass. Good lighter crisp carbonation. Big smooth chewy body, more dry finish. Great texture. Good bitter sweet chocolate flavor. Nice and roasty. Some dark chocolate. Not sure if Id have noticed the rye if it wasnt on the label, but I do think there is a nice presence of toasty rye malts in here, its subtle but tasty. Slight hint of raspberry, too? Im a fan. All Ive had from Terrapin so far is the Wake-N-Bake, but this is up to snuff with that.

This beer was the last sample to be served on a tour at the Nøgne Ø brewery, and the many subtleties of this one probably escaped my tired palate. However, I did pick up notes of chocolate and coffee in the aroma and these were found in the flavours as well. Good bitter finish. The mouthfeel is absolutely incredible, its silky smooth and full bodied. Good stuff, but I desperately want to re-rate this one properly.
[10 cl sample from bottle at Nøgne Ø]

Draught at Copenhagen Ølfestival 2012.  Black color. Aromas of coffee and nuts. Bittersweet flavor with coffee, nuts, salty licorice and toffee. Bitter, coffeish and warming finish. Strong tasting yet pleasant sipper. Quite coffeish.

Copenhagen Beer Festival, May 2012. Black with a small off-white head. Malty aroma with chocolate, a fine touch of coffee and a fruity note. Sweet and full bodied dark malty flavour with lots of chocolate and a citrus hoppy finish

Medium dark brown head. Opaque black body. Alcoholic fruity banana aroma with licorice, earth and chocolate notes. Dry-sweet perfumy strawberry and banana taste with roasty chocolatey notes. Full-bodied. Mild, soft, mealy mouthfeel. Dryish-sweet roasty grainy fruity aftertaste with perfumy licorice notes. Nice. Scarily drinkable. Interesting and different, too. (0.5l bottle, Grünerløkka Bryghus, Oslo.)

This is a lovely and really great ale. And you can read a lot about it here. So I rather tell a funny story about it. I found this gem in Belgium. Brewed in Norway and travelled all the way down to The Belgians. But still half the price as in Norway!. Then it travelled through Luxembourg to Holland and Egmond Aam Zee where it ended it journey. Outstanding![Bottle from Mi-Orge Mi-Houblon in Arlon, Belgium]

Medium brown-beige head over well-carbonated black beer. Ink, mocha, chocolate - both bitter and sweet. Then cheesy hops flaring up, as well as alcohol/fusels. Bitter, woody, hoppy and again lots of chocolate - probably chocolatemalt indeed. Something herbal playing, as basil after being heated. Feels well-carbonated, spritzy. Long, quite bitter-roasted aftertaste. Severe, but convincing porter.

Draught at Danske Ølentusiasters Ølfestival 2012, CopenhagenBlack color, with brown creamy head. Moderate aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, ass. Strong flavor of dark chocolate, but also a bit too much roasted malt, liquorice; salty finish; good body strength, and the mouthfeel is quite round thanks to some residual sweetness.Good, not impressive.

Flaske 0,5l på Antikvariatet, Trondheim 14 Jun 12. Kullsort med et kjempehøyt mokkafarget skum. Betong. God sjokoladearoma. Oljeaktig konsistens. Godt integrerte smaker: Sjokolade & lakris. Litt tørr bitterhet etter hvert. Avslutter syrlig. Alkoholen merkes overhode ikke!

Sampled at DØE Beerfestival 2012, TAP1. Pours a pitch black beer with a beige head. The aroma is malt, roasted, chocolate, coffee, notes of licorice and hops. The flavor follows the nose with additional alcohol and malt acidity. The palate is sweetness. Overall a good, rounded and complex beer.
Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate coffee and liquorish. Flavour is roasted malt, alcohol, chocolate, coffee and liquorish.

Black pour. Big tan head, whipped cream consistency. Plenty of lacing as the head slowly fades. Big chocolate, spicy malt aroma. Little bit of a hop character. Malty, chocolate, pepper. Pretty good. Spicy back with a big hop bitterness. Pretty good beer.

On tap at Henrik, Bergen. Pours a pitch black colour with a medium brown head. The aroma is dominated by a lot of coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malt. Sweet malt in the flavour along with chocolate and a touch of rye. Has a soft mouthfeel. Bitterness = medium+. A terrific and well-balanced porter.

4/VI/2012 - 50cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ Fokkes place - bottled: 10/II/12 - BB: 10/II/17 (2012-598) 
Dark brown beer, small brown head, unstable, bit adhesive, viscose pour. Aroma: very fruity, sweet, bit soapy, honey, some mocha, bread, yeast, caramel. MF: soft carbon, full body, soft creamy texture. Taste: some sweet caramel, creamed mocha, spices, bit sour, roasted malts, bit soapy, floral touch. Aftertaste: mocha, caramel, some coffee, hop bitter, little sour.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors Black with good creme head. 
Aroma is coffee, liquorice, malts. 
Taste coffee, a nice sweet and good choco bitter, rye, hint of alcohol. 
Mouth-feel cremy. 
Very nice porter.

Fad: Sort olieret øl med et flot brunligt skumhoved. Duften er chokolade og kaffe med en god del sødlige malte. Smagen er igen meget chokolade og en god del porter, forstået i min bog som den sødlige malt. Fint afbalanceret af en diskret humling. Dejlig øl.
On tap at CBC. Pours black with a creamy beige head. The aroma is roasted malt, fruit and light chocolate. The flavour is roasted malt, fruit, chocolate, light hops and liquorice. Creamy texture.
12th May 2012On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Opaque black beer, little tan head. Softish palate, dry. Mild rye spice in the dark malt. A little minerals. Not much else to say, dry finish.

Tap @ CBC, 2012.
Pours black with a fine, creamy, beige head. Super lacing. Aroma is sweet, chocolate, clear rye, light coffee and some lactose sweetness. Medium to low carbonation, fine dry and super-creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet, light bitterness, coffee, rye spiciness. Long, lingering bitter finish. Good.
Very dark brown with a small tan head. Malty with roasted tones. Malt, cofee and bitterness. Full body with a nice, bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours dark, with a small dark head. Aroma is sweet coffee, and a malty burned bitterness. Quite oily body. Dark flavour with coffee, liquorice and tobacco, which gives a lot of taste and a long nice finish.

Tap @ Haand festival.
Pour black, with a small tan head.
Aroma of roasted malts, bitter chocolate, coffee and slight licorice.
Taste is a little bitter, but well balanced. Semi-thick body, with a slightly flat carbonation. I really like this porter.
DØE. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. Oily. 100512
CBC 2012, Copenhagen. Black beer with a minimal beige head. Fruity, chocolate, licorice, malty, raisins aroma. Chocolate, licorice, russin, hoppy, figs flavour.

Tap @ DØE Øl Festival 2012. Almost black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and a little liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, hops, medium sweet and a little bitter.
CBC 2012. Pours pitch black with a small tanned head. Aroma is smokey roasted malty dry hay. Flavor is sweet peppery pungent bitter fruity dark fruits molasses. Finishes bitter sweet and roasted.

Draught at DBF2012.
Black with a light brown head. Aroma heavy malty (bread, roasted, spicy, dark fruits, chocolate). Flavor medium sweet and bitter, light spicy, in a good balance. Full body, smooth.
Copenhagen Beer Festival, 2012. Pours black with a small creamy beige head. Roasted, smooth and slick with a bit of coffee and liquorice. Straight forwarded.
On tap at Copenhagen Beer Festival. A rich, fullbodied och smooth imperial porter. Dark berries, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, some smoke, rye and bitter hops. Ends quite bitter. Really good.

Draught at CBC. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma. Fantastic wonderfull complex heavy bitter flavior. Long great finish. Outstanding palate. World class beer.

On tap at CBF 2012. Pours pitch black with a small tanned head. Aroma is malty, rich roasted, bitter hops.Taste is moderate sweet, thick like soy sauce, dark berries, chocolate and coffee. Ends quite bitter.

tap at cbc.
pitch dark, large smooth brown head. aroma is roasted malty, chocolate, dry. flavor is chocolate, roasted malts, wood , caramel.

On tap at Ølfestival 2012.

Black with a small brownish head. Aroma and taste of roasted malt, some smoke, rye and bitter hops. The mouth feel was creamy. I liked this one.
Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012. Black beer with a small head. Malty chocolate aroma, cocoa, licorice, raisins. Chocolate flavor, cocoa, licorice, figs, raisins, licorice notes, sourish, hop notes.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2012 03-NOV-2012, bottle @home, norsk butik close to Mikkeller. 
Much more and lasting head this time from bottle. 
Sweet roast and loads of hops. Some alcohol. Just a fine porter. Raised the rating. Nor very often I prefer the bottle over draught version.

10-MAY-2012, draft @DØE Ølfestival 2012.
Almost black and almost ni head.
Bready - rugbrød. Very malty. Rye is evident in taste but alsto in texture,
Sweet. Fine brew.

Sample from tap, CBF 2012. Pitch black colour with a dark brown head. Sweet and roasted aroma with malt, caramel, rye and bread. Sweet taste with malts, roasted notes, chocolate and rye. Full body with an oily texture. Long lasting, bitter finish. The best experience at this festival.
Draught. No head. Pitch balck body. Mild coffee choccolate aroma and flavor. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste. Would never have guessed the alcohol level.
Draught, 9%. Black colour. Small dark brown head. Roasted flavour, mild grassy hop aroma.

Draught @ Ølfestival København

Pours pitch black with a small white head. Aroma of roasted malts, rye, hints of smoke. Taste is quite heavy bodied with a lot of rye notes and roasted malts. Finish is malty and slightly sticky with roasty notes. Tasty, well balanced.

Draught @ Ølfestival København 2012.
Pours a pitch black colour with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, rye, cream and syrup. Flavour of roasted malts, rye, bitter hops and strong bready maltiness. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a roasty, bready and bitter finish. Great stuff and also quite heavy.

Draught @ Ølfestival København 2012
Sweet aroma is, surprisingly, high on rye. Also hints of coffee. Flavour is sweetish with rye. Roasted malt, dark chocolate and coffee in the finish. Creamy and very smooth palate. Nice.

Draught @ Ølfestival Kobenhavn.
Pours pitch black color with a huge foamy head. Aroma of distinct rye, toasted malts, ripe fruit notes, some caramel, toffee hints and some honey notes. Flavor of caramel, toasted malts, rye, some grain and vanilla hints. Smooth palate with a mild dry malty finish. Very nice.
5426

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade 8BC, kld., DK-1655 Copenhagen, Denmark.Dark black brown colour with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, beige to light brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, dark chocolate, caramel, licorice, light to moderate hoppy. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, creamy, chocolate, licorice. Body is medium to medium full, texture is oily - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20120419]

50cl, new exclusive Norwegian collab. brew Anno 2012, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex Porter, roasted/spicy and slightly fruity/bitter, not too heavy, balanced, cloudy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!

Draft courtesy of the Ladies of Nogne O, Ilsa and Ingrd - thanks!  Murky brown color, small beige head. Aroma of slightly sour coffee grounds and pumpernickel bread. Taste is sour plums, raisins, coffee, subtle cocoa. Nicely complex and full of character.

Sampled @ Hanne på Høyden. This one pours a dark dark cola-brown body with a small quickly sidesticking tan head. On the aroma its really lovely roasted and sweet with dark dried fruits, dark chocolate, sticky dark caramel and hints of some alcohol. Quite lovely. It has that nice thick and almost viscous, creamy texture with a average, small bubbled carbonation level. In flavor its not unexpectedly, dark, bitter and roasted. I get some clear dark Belgian chocolate, with tons of roasted malts. It feels really round and delicious in the flavors this. It also has a extreme-lasting warming roasted chocolate aftertaste thats literally making me taste the beer for a very long time after Ive swallowed it. Theyve done it again! 11.04.2012

500 ml bottle, batch #761, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 9%. 45 IBU. Pitch black colour, large and creamy tan head. Very nice aroma with roasty and fruity notes, notes of sour berries, oak, red wine vinegar, mild coffee and dark chocolate. The flavour is sweet and roasty, notes of coffee, dark bitter chocolate and liquorice. Bitter finish.

Bottle 500ml @ Geokkjer
Pours almost black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate and rye. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long sweet chocolate finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonaiton is soft.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate, rye, malt, roasted malt and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and roasted with some chocolate, fruity, rye, spice and malt. Medium body, average carbonation.

On tap at Patricks. Dark brown colour with a tan head. Aroma is fruit, coffee, licorice, roasted malt. Flavour is roasted malt, coffee, hop, rye, alcohol, coffee, cocoa, licorice, fruit. Full body. Nice beer.

On cask. Pitch black with a small. Aroma is perfumed and sweet, but I cant quite put my fonger on anything else. Flavour is also sweey, yet subtle. Notes of rye, malts, sugar. Medium long aftertaste.

On cask at Håndverkerstuene. Black with a minimal head. Aroma of roasted malt, wood, burnt, chocolate, and hints of coffee and tar. Noticable alcohol, but pretty well integrated. Smooth and quite drinkable.
Tap at Mikkeller bar. Black with a small beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, coffee and licorice.

On cask at Håndverkerstuene
Dark brown, black in glass, very little head (because of the cask i guess).
Smells powerfully of earthy tones, roasted malts and coffee. Taste is heavy maltym nice medium sweetness, alot of roast and coffee. Also some nice tastes i cant identify. Full bodied, flat carbonation, very very oily feel. Nice heavy bitter finish, quite hoppy, earthy tones and coffee bitterness. I very nice beer that i want to try from keg or bottle as well

330 ml cask at Håndverkerstuene. Nutty oily malty aroma with notes of raisins and toffee. Peppery bitter flavours, especially in the finish. Nice oily texture. Served rather warm. Alcohol notes with some fusel notes. Licorice and dark chocolate. Finish is dry and a little sharp. Salty and papery.

On tap at Amundsen
Black color
Very full body & very high complexity
Very powerful beer, a bit too heavy for me

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Black coloured with a small beige head.
Roasted aroma of caramel and coffee with notes of chocolate.
Roasted flavour of caramel, coffee, chocolate and hops.
Roasted and hoppy finish.

On tap. Opaque black with a small, light brown head. Pruney aroma with only a subtle whiff of roast. Full and rich body, fairly intense, roast and again prune juice, dark and bitter chocolate accents. Ends bitter from both malts and hops. Very chewy - kinda grew on me. 180412

Draft. A pitch black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, caramel, rye, and bread. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, liquid chocolate, lightly roasted bread, and rye, leading to a bitter finish.

Feom tap at MikkellerBar. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is dense malty, breadish and caramelish. Creamy mouthfeel, thick. Light liqourice, dark chocolate and burned roasted malt notes. Bitter, roasted and dark chocolate. Light alcohol presence into the finish. Dark malty lasting impression.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2012 Draught at MikkellerBAR. Black - brown head. Burned. Fruity. Licorice. High malty. Sweetness. Ok bitterness. High licorice. Nice light spicy rye. Light sharp boozy and hoppy finish.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black body with a large beige creamy retention, which lasts for a long time and leaves lacings on the glass. Beautiful. Aroma is somewhat faint, with mild licorice, hints of dark chocolate, rye grains and coffee. Taste is much more evident: strong tones of licorice, coffee and rye bread-like cereal tones, herbs and grass. The flavors seem well integrated in a fruity kind of way as opposed to roasty. Hints of alcohol, but well hidden. Palate is thick, velvety and very nice. A solid imperial porter, but I long for a more noticable rye flavor as well as a more noticable aroma. Still, this is very nice.

50 cl bottle at home. Black color, lovely brown and lasting head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, hops. Flavor is roasted malt coffee and chocolate,, medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Extremely smooth and creamy. Alcohol is well hidden. Some liqorice in the finish. Lovely beer.

500 ml bottle. Very dark brown body, almost black with a nice, dense, lasting beige head. Aroma of dark, relatively mild roasted malt, coffee, citric hops and hint of yeast. Flavor has a really pleasant soft roasted malt, espresso coffee, dark chocolate, hint of liquorices, some citric fruit and a very balanced bitterness. Full body, long aftertaste. Very well hidden alcohol. A very nice and tasty one thats surprisingly quaffable at the same time. Well done.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2012 Bottle, Daglighallen, Trondheim. Pours dark brown, borderline black. Nice offwhite foam with some brown notes. Aroma is yeast and chocolate. Tastes of herbs and loads of chocolate. Also some yeast-notes. Smooth and round brew.

Bottle. It pours a dense, almost creamy, tan head of two-finger size. Both lasting and lacings producing. Not black in color, but pretty close. The aroma is on the dark side, as expected, with roasted malts, mocha, milk chocolate and some alcohol notes and a pleasant piney, citrus peel-like hoppyness. Mellow and pleasant. Really pleasant actually, even though Im not in the mood for dark, heavy ales for the moment. The flavor continues what the aroma started, its oily and smooth on the palate, although a bit warming. Soft carbonation, and towards the end the bitterness adds another dimension to the flavor. As mentioned, Im not in the mood to drink on the dark side these days, but I certainly enjoyed it anyway. 120322

Shared bottle @ Nøgne Ø, Grimstad. Very dark brown, almost black, ruby highlights when directed against the light. Nice little head. Aromas of dark chocolate, coffee, slightly hops, spices. Flavors of chocolate, some roastyness, and some acidic note of spices from the rye. Full body. Really nice mouthfeel. A great porter from Nøgne Ø / Terrapin.

Sweet malty, fruity aroma. Hoppy sweet citrus flavor. Nice body and a very pleasant aftertaste.

Spicy, strong and concentrated. Bordering on the medical. A little smoke, some pumpernickel. More of an elexir than a beer, but try it if you can find it!
